_data.title: Full Stack Software Engineer

children.value: Overview

We're looking for a strong Full Stack Software engineer. Headquartered in Los Angeles, California, Right Balance applies the latest technology and the best engineering practices to help businesses grow. We’re in the top 50 companies to watch in LA.
Project Details

Our client’s mission is to connect online and offline identities in a way that promotes understanding, fairness, and accountability; aiming to use this connected identity to better inform the most important decisions we make as humans. Backed by some of the world’s leading venture capitalists and institutional investors, they are an AI-based software solution that identifies problematic behavior among potential hires and current employees by analyzing publicly available online information. Enterprise Human Resources and Talent Acquisition Leaders from numerous large companies trust them to identify abusive behaviors, such as bigotry and harassment, that are often missed in the hiring and management process.

By using Data Science and Machine Learning, they are helping hundreds of brands across the globe to screen thousands of people every month, while rapidly growing their traffic 30% month over month by utilizing the SaaS model.

Our Python-based Serverless Microservices with FastAPI on the backend power our modern web frontend applications written in React / Redux. Lots of greenfield development for new Microservices as well as Microfrontends. We’re using the latest AWS services like Aurora, Lambda, EventBridge, believing in automated testing and solid DevOps principles. Plenty of scaling challenges as well as exposure to Machine Learning and Data Science. Join us, it’ll be fun!
What’s in it for you
Work with the latest and greatest technologies.
Learn from the best people. We constantly challenge the status quo, learn from each other, and invent new ways of building a great product.
We actually write automated tests. We take advantage of the latest automation tools like automatic deployments, CI/CD pipelines, and more.
Flexible hours. Just join daily standups, sprint planning, and retrospective meetings. Other than that you’re in control of your own schedule.
Work remotely at the comfort of your home or a shared co-working space.
Work on challenging problems, innovate, have fun while doing it.
Travel around the world. We offer occasional business trips to work with our clients face to face from their offices.
Required Qualifications
5+ years of hands-on full-time coding experience.
2+ years of modern Javascript frontend using React / Redux or similar.
5+ years of backend experience using FastAPI / Flask / Django or similar or Node.js / Express or similar.
Experience in both Javascript and Python.
1+ years of experience building and managing software products on AWS (or GCP or Azure) cloud services, preferably focused on AWS serverless technologies.
1+ years working within teams that believe in and live the principles of lean-agile product development.
Upper-intermediate to Advanced level of verbal English.
Strong ability to communicate clearly and authoritatively with both technical and non-technical teams.
Excited to learn new languages and technologies, and eager to build software using them, learning from your colleagues.
Comfortable working with diverse people and teams across the organization, from operations analysts to the CEO.
Believe in the client’s mission, work every day to live that mission, and help others do the same.
Believe that in the world of Product Engineering, DevOps is king, meaning engineers own the product, from design to implementation, QA to production support.
Unit test experience.
Nice to haves
Professional experience with many of these technologies: Java, Golang, Javascript,
React, Spring, Django, Cassandra, Kafka, MongoDB, Postgres, or other RDBMS
Knowledge of Runtime and memory complexity using Big O notation.
Deep understanding of automated testing, ability to set up automated testing frameworks, testing architecture, data seeding, mocking, and implementing best testing practices.
Open-source contributions, presentations, and publications.
Team leadership experience.
Team management experience.

What are your typical clients?

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups at the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company already achieved a product-market fit and is looking to expand rapidly. That’s where we bring the best engineering practices, strong architecture, and the latest technologies to help companies scale.
What is the length of your projects?
Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years.
What’s your company size?

What happens if the engagement is completed?
Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current project is ramping down, we’ll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.
What are your core values?

Enterprise Human Resources and Talent Acquisition Leaders from numerous large companies trust them to identify abusive behaviors, such as bigotry and harassment, that are often missed in the hiring and management process.

By using Data Science and Machine Learning, they are helping hundreds of brands across the globe to screen thousands of people every month, while rapidly growing their traffic 30% month over month by utilizing the SaaS model.

Our Python-based Serverless Microservices with FastAPI on the backend power our modern web frontend applications written in React / Redux. Lots of greenfield development for new Microservices as well as Microfrontends. We’re using the latest AWS services like Aurora, Lambda, EventBridge, believing in automated testing and solid DevOps principles. Plenty of scaling challenges as well as exposure to Machine Learning and Data Science. Join us, it’ll be fun!

## What’s in it for you

1. Work with the latest and greatest technologies.
2. Learn from the best people. We constantly challenge the status quo, learn from each other, and invent new ways of building a great product.
3. We actually write automated tests. We take advantage of the latest automation tools like automatic deployments, CI/CD pipelines, and more.
4. Flexible hours. Just join daily standups, sprint planning, and retrospective meetings. Other than that you’re in control of your own schedule.
5. Work remotely at the comfort of your home or a shared co-working space.
6. Work on challenging problems, innovate, have fun while doing it.
7. Travel around the world. We offer occasional business trips to work with our clients face to face from their offices.

## Required Qualifications

 1. 5+ years of hands-on full-time coding experience.
 2. 2+ years of modern Javascript frontend using React / Redux or similar.
 3. 5+ years of backend experience using FastAPI / Flask / Django or similar or Node.js / Express or similar.
 4. Experience in both Javascript and Python.
 5. 1+ years of experience building and managing software products on AWS (or GCP or Azure) cloud services, preferably focused on AWS serverless technologies.
 6. 1+ years working within teams that believe in and live the principles of lean-agile product development.
 7. Upper-intermediate to Advanced level of verbal English.
 8. Strong ability to communicate clearly and authoritatively with both technical and non-technical teams.
 9. Excited to learn new languages and technologies, and eager to build software using them, learning from your colleagues.
10. Comfortable working with diverse people and teams across the organization, from operations analysts to the CEO.
11. Believe in the client’s mission, work every day to live that mission, and help others do the same.
12. Believe that in the world of Product Engineering, DevOps is king, meaning engineers own the product, from design to implementation, QA to production support.
13. Unit test experience.

## Nice to haves

1. Professional experience with many of these technologies: Java, Golang, Javascript,

   React, Spring, Django, Cassandra, Kafka, MongoDB, Postgres, or other RDBMS
2. Knowledge of Runtime and memory complexity using Big O notation.
3. Deep understanding of automated testing, ability to set up automated testing frameworks, testing architecture, data seeding, mocking, and implementing best testing practices.
4. Open-source contributions, presentations, and publications.
5. Team leadership experience.
6. Team management experience.

## Frequently Asked Questions

> What are your typical clients?

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups at the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company already achieved a product-market fit and is looking to expand rapidly. That’s where we bring the best engineering practices, strong architecture, and the latest technologies to help companies scale.

> What is the length of your projects?

Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years.

> What’s your company size?

The Right Balance team is 30+ engineers looking to double in the next 12 months. The current client size team is 80+ engineers and more than 325 employees in total.

> What happens if the engagement is completed?

Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current project is ramping down, we’ll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.

> What are your core values?

We value autonomy, grind, empathy, mastery, and giving back to the community. We expect you to be autonomous, working directly with the client to build the best product. We value hard work, helping each other, constant learning as well as open-source contributions, and knowledge sharing.

children.value: Overview

We're looking for an Integration Engineer. Headquartered in Los Angeles, California, Right Balance applies the latest technology and best engineering practices to help businesses grow. We’re in the top 50 companies to watch in LA.
Engagement Details

Our client is reinventing the formalwear rental industry so people can show up at their best on the days that matter most. The company designs and manufactures modern rental suits and tuxedos that actually fit—made of 100% wool, ordered online, and delivered for free. Using a combination of machine learning and industry-leading customer service, client guarantee a perfect fit every time. Just as we are on the cutting-edge of men's fashion, we also strive to stay on the cutting-edge of technology and looking to hire a Mid-level Software Engineer.

Our biggest goals on the technology team are to deliver the best possible customer experience, building solutions that adhere to high software engineering principles, and striving to maintain a positive culture where diversity and personal growth are highly valued.
What’s in it for you
1. Learn and evolve your skills using the latest and greatest technology tools in a rapidly growing company
2. Learn from the best engineers. We constantly challenge the status quo and invent new ways of building a great product.
3. Flexible hours. Just join daily standups, sprint planning, and retrospective meetings. Other than that you’re in control of your own schedule
4. 100% remote. Work anywhere, whether it is remotely in the comfort of your home, in a shared co-working space, in an RV on the beach, or while being a nomad in another country.
5. Work on challenging problems, innovate, impacting lots of people's lives for the better while having fun doing it.
Required Qualifications
1. 5+ years of full-time hands-on Integration Engineer experience.
2. Upper-intermediate to fluent speaking and writing English. Able to have a real-time conversation.
3. 3+ years of full-time hands-on Python experience.
4. 1+ years of full-time hands-on AWS (or GCP or Azure) experience.
5. 1+ years of full-time hands-on Serverless experience.
6. 1+ years of full-time hands-on SQL experience.
7. Serverless experience (API Gateway, SQS, SNS, Lambda, or analogous services from Azure or GCP).
8. Serverless architecture mindset (not doing everything on an EC2 box).
9. SQL data modeling experience.
Nice to haves
1. Node.js experience.
2. Celigo experience.
3. Shopify experience.
4. Netsuite experience.
5. Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent demonstrated ability.
6. Excellent verbal & written communication skills.
Frequently Asked Questions
What are your typical clients?

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups in the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company already achieved a product-market fit and is looking to expand rapidly. That’s where we bring the best engineering practices, strong architecture, and the latest technologies to help companies scale.
What is the length of your engagements?
Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years so you are able to evolve your career with the company you are currently working in.
What’s your company size?

The Right Balance team is 60+ engineers going to 200 by the end of the year. The current client size team is 150+ people. The timing is great to be a part of a rapidly growing team making meaningful contributions.
What happens if the engagement is completed?
Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current engagement is ramping down, we’ll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.
What are your core values?
Client First: we only win when our clients win. We treat client challenges as our own.
Ownership: we embrace responsibility, taking on challenges, getting them to completion, and enjoying getting things done.
Quality: we’re passionate about achieving quality outcomes by applying meticulous attention to detail.

We're looking for a Product Analyst. Headquartered in Los Angeles, California, Right Balance applies the latest technology and best engineering practices to help businesses grow. We’re in the top 50 companies to watch in LA.
Engagement Details

We're a fast-growing, pioneering financial education start-up that invests heavily in the growth and development of its team members. As a financial education company, we provide a turn-key collaborative money mentorship solution that’s derived from the belief that our financial mentors are the last great hope for educating the working population on healthy money habits and positive behavior change. We seek to spread financial literacy by creating custom programs tailored to organizational needs that ease monetary stress and equip employees with how to plan for their future.

You will play a crucial role in shaping our financial wellness platform and driving data-informed decision-making. You will work closely with cross-functional teams, including product managers, designers, engineers, and stakeholders, to gather user insights, conduct market research, analyze data, and contribute to the product development process. We're actively trying to ""break"" the industry. The industry is really for disruption and innovation.
What’s in it for you
1. Learn and evolve your skills using the latest and greatest technology tools in a rapidly growing company
2. Learn from the best engineers. We constantly challenge the status quo and invent new ways of building a great product.
3. Flexible hours. Just join daily standups, sprint planning, and retrospective meetings. Other than that you’re in control of your own schedule
4. 100% remote. Work anywhere, whether it is remotely in the comfort of your home, in a shared co-working space, in an RV on the beach, or while being a nomad in another country.
5. Work on challenging problems, innovate, impacting lots of people's lives for the better while having fun doing it.
Required Qualifications
Total: 3+ years of hands-on full-time Product Analyst experience
1+ years of hands-on full-time experience with Project Management
2+ years of hands-on full-time experience with Product Management
Analytical Mindset: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to analyze data and draw meaningful insights.
Communication: Excellent communication skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and present information clearly.
Product Management Skills: Familiarity with product management methodologies, Agile development.
Technical Writing Experience: Demonstrated experience in creating technical documentation for software products and technologies.
Proactive communication: being able to challenge the status quo, proactively gather and break down requirements into actionable stories.
Upper-intermediate to fluent speaking and writing English. Able to have a real-time conversation.
Nice to haves
1. Bachelor's or Master's Degree: A degree in Product Management, Data Science, Technical Writing, Computer Science, or a related field.

## Overview

We're looking for a Product Analyst. Headquartered in Los Angeles, California, Right Balance applies the latest technology and best engineering practices to help businesses grow. We’re in the top 50 companies to watch in LA.

## Engagement Details

We're a fast-growing, pioneering financial education start-up that invests heavily in the growth and development of its team members. As a financial education company, we provide a turn-key collaborative money mentorship solution that’s derived from the belief that our financial mentors are the last great hope for educating the working population on healthy money habits and positive behavior change. We seek to spread financial literacy by creating custom programs tailored to organizational needs that ease monetary stress and equip employees with how to plan for their future.

You will play a crucial role in shaping our financial wellness platform and driving data-informed decision-making. You will work closely with cross-functional teams, including product managers, designers, engineers, and stakeholders, to gather user insights, conduct market research, analyze data, and contribute to the product development process. We're actively trying to ""break"" the industry. The industry is really for disruption and innovation.

## What’s in it for you

1\. Learn and evolve your skills using the latest and greatest technology tools in a rapidly growing company

2\. Learn from the best engineers. We constantly challenge the status quo and invent new ways of building a great product.

3\. Flexible hours. Just join daily standups, sprint planning, and retrospective meetings. Other than that you’re in control of your own schedule

4\. 100% remote. Work anywhere, whether it is remotely in the comfort of your home, in a shared co-working space, in an RV on the beach, or while being a nomad in another country.

5\. Work on challenging problems, innovate, impacting lots of people's lives for the better while having fun doing it.

## Required Qualifications

- Total: 3+ years of hands-on full-time Product Analyst experience

- 1+ years of hands-on full-time experience with Project Management

- 2+ years of hands-on full-time experience with Product Management

- Analytical Mindset: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to analyze data and draw meaningful insights.

- Communication: Excellent communication skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and present information clearly.

- Product Management Skills: Familiarity with product management methodologies, Agile development.

- Technical Writing Experience: Demonstrated experience in creating technical documentation for software products and technologies.

- Proactive communication: being able to challenge the status quo, proactively gather and break down requirements into actionable stories.

- Upper-intermediate to fluent speaking and writing English. Able to have a real-time conversation.

## Nice to haves

1\. Bachelor's or Master's Degree: A degree in Product Management, Data Science, Technical Writing, Computer Science, or a related field.

2\. Experience with user-centered design principles.

3\. Financial Literacy: An understanding of financial wellness concepts or a willingness to learn about the financial education industry.

4\. Excellent verbal & written communication skills. 

## Frequently Asked Questions

>_What are your typical clients?_

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups at the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company already achieved a product-market fit and is looking to expand rapidly. That’s where we bring the best engineering practices, strong architecture, and the latest technologies to help companies scale.

>_What is the length of your engagements?_

Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years so you are able to evolve your career with the company you are currently working in.

>_What’s your company size?_

The Right Balance team is 60+ engineers going to 200 by the end of the year. The current client size team is 150+ people. The timing is great to be a part of a rapidly growing team making meaningful contributions.

>_What happens if the engagement is completed?_

Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current engagement is ramping down, we’ll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.

>_What are your core values?_

Client First: we only win when our clients win. We treat client challenges as our own.

Ownership: we embrace responsibility, taking on challenges, getting them to completion, and enjoying getting things done.

Quality: we’re passionate about achieving quality outcomes by applying meticulous attention to detail.

We're looking for a Project Manager. Headquartered in Los Angeles, California, Right Balance applies the latest technology and best engineering practices to help businesses grow. We’re in the top 50 companies to watch in LA.
Project Details

Our company is seeking an experienced technical project manager to work directly with the engineering team, managing projects from inception to launch and post-launch reporting. We are a world-class start-up that provides access to a shared closet where members can borrow designer handbags, jewelry, and diamonds. We are a venture-backed, high-growth business that offers competitive compensation in a creative, flexible environment that invests in its professionals.
This position reports to the VP of Engineering. Vivrelle is headquartered in New York City, but this role can be fully remote.

Your responsibilities will include: ● Plan, execute, monitor, track and report on technology projects using Agile development processes & techniques. ● Develop project plans and schedules, including scope, resources, budgets, and timelines. ● Coordinate the efforts of cross-functional teams, including software developers, quality assurance, and product management ● Monitor and report on project progress, including status updates and risk management. ● Facilitate communication between team members, stakeholders, and clients. ● Ensure that all project deliverables meet the required quality standards and are completed on time. ● Conduct project reviews and retrospectives to identify lessons learned and opportunities for improvement. ● Manage agile sprint cycles - Scrum Master, grooming, sprint planning and retrospectives. ● Document current processes and pushing the business forward by defining new processes with an eye for efficiency. ● KPI definition, tracking and reporting. ● JIRA management. ● Engineering calendar management.

## **_Overview_**

We're looking for a Project Manager. Headquartered in Los Angeles, California, Right Balance applies the latest technology and best engineering practices to help businesses grow. We’re in the top 50 companies to watch in LA.

## **_Project Details_**

Our company is seeking an experienced technical project manager to work directly with the engineering team, managing projects from inception to launch and post-launch reporting. We are a world-class start-up that provides access to a shared closet where members can borrow designer handbags, jewelry, and diamonds. We are a venture-backed, high-growth business that offers competitive compensation in a creative, flexible environment that invests in its professionals.

This position reports to the VP of Engineering. Vivrelle is headquartered in New York City, but this role can be fully remote.

Your responsibilities will include:
● Plan, execute, monitor, track and report on technology projects using Agile development processes & techniques.
● Develop project plans and schedules, including scope, resources, budgets, and timelines.
● Coordinate the efforts of cross-functional teams, including software developers, quality assurance, and product management
● Monitor and report on project progress, including status updates and risk management.
● Facilitate communication between team members, stakeholders, and clients.
● Ensure that all project deliverables meet the required quality standards and are completed on time.
● Conduct project reviews and retrospectives to identify lessons learned and opportunities for improvement.
● Manage agile sprint cycles - Scrum Master, grooming, sprint planning and retrospectives.
● Document current processes and pushing the business forward by defining new processes with an eye for efficiency.
● KPI definition, tracking and reporting.
● JIRA management.
● Engineering calendar management.

## **_What’s in it for you_**

1. Learn and evolve your skills using the latest and greatest technology tools in a rapidly growing company.
2. Learn from the best engineers. We constantly challenge the status quo and invent new ways of building a great product.
3. Flexible hours. Just join daily standups, sprint planning, and retrospective meetings. Other than that you’re in control of your own schedule.
4. 100% remote. Work anywhere, whether it is remotely in the comfort of your home, in a shared co-working space, in an RV on the beach, or while being a nomad in another country.
5. Work on challenging problems, innovate, impacting lots of people's lives for the better while having fun doing it.

## **_Required Qualifications_**

1. 5+ years of full-time hands-on Project Management experience.
2. Upper-intermediate to fluent speaking and writing English. Able to have a real-time conversation.
3. Jira usage and administration experience.
4. Experience running SCRUM ceremonies.
5. Understanding of basic software engineering language and concepts.
6. Experience defining and tracking KPIs for agile engineering teams.
7. Experience managing cross functional projects (between Marketing, Engineering, Operations, etc).
8. Detail oriented and organized.
9. Experience with note taking during meetings.

## **_Nice to haves_**

1. Experience administering vendors (managing contract renewal schedule, etc).
2. Experience with interview scheduling.

## **_Frequently Asked Questions_**

> **_What are your typical clients?_**

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups in the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company already achieved a product-market fit and is looking to expand rapidly. That’s where we bring the best engineering practices, strong architecture, and the latest technologies to help companies scale.

> **_What is the length of your engagements?_**

Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years so you are able to grow your career with the company you are currently working in.

> **_What’s your company size?_**

The Right Balance team is 60+ engineers going to 200+ by the end of 2023. The current client size team is 50 people. It’s exciting to be a part of the solid engineering team making meaningful contributions.

> **_What happens if the engagement is completed?_**

Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current engagement is ramping down, we’ll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.

> **_What are your core values?_**

* Client First: we only win when our clients win. We treat client challenges as our own.
* Ownership: we embrace responsibility, taking on challenges, getting them to completion, and enjoying getting things done.
* Quality: we’re passionate about achieving quality outcomes by applying meticulous attention to detail.

Travel around the world. We offer occasional business trips to work with our clients face-to-face from their offices.

Experience working with SOAP API.
SQLServerBack-endvalidationexperience.

children.value: Overview

We're looking for a QA Engineer. Headquartered in Los Angeles, California, Right Balance applies the latest technology and best engineering practices to help businesses grow. We’re in the top 50 companies to watch in LA.
Engagement Details

We're a fast-growing, pioneering financial wellness start-up that invests heavily in the growth and development of its team members. As a financial education company, we provide a turn-key collaborative money mentorship solution that’s derived from the belief that our financial mentors are the last great hope for educating the working population on healthy money habits and positive behavior change. We seek to spread financial literacy by creating custom programs tailored to organizational needs that ease monetary stress and equip employees with how to plan for their future.

Support the development of our web and mobile applications. The ideal candidate will thrive in a dynamic environment, have a deep understanding of best practices for performance / stress / load testing and have solid attention to detail. Our platform leverages .NET, Azure DevOps, AWS, Docker. There are a lot of fun things to work on such as appointment scheduling system, live video integration, subscription services, payments, and so on.
What’s in it for you
1. Learn and evolve your skills using the latest and greatest technology tools in a rapidly growing company
2. Learn from the best engineers. We constantly challenge the status quo and invent new ways of building a great product.
3. Flexible hours. Just join daily standups, sprint planning, and retrospective meetings. Other than that you’re in control of your own schedule
4. 100% remote. Work anywhere, whether it is remotely in the comfort of your home, in a shared co-working space, in an RV on the beach, or while being a nomad in another country.
5. Work on challenging problems, innovate, impacting lots of people's lives for the better while having fun doing it.
Required Qualifications
4+ years of hands-on full-time experience as a QA Engineer.
4+ years of hands-on full-time experience with Manual QA.
2+ years of hands-on full-time experience with Mobile testing.
4+ years of hands-on full-time experience with Web application testing.
Advanced speaking and writing English. Able to have a real-time conversation.
Experience with testing of both desktop and mobile web applications.
Experience debugging and troubleshooting complex issues using tools like Postman, Charles Proxy, Chrome Tools, Firebase, TestFlight or equivalent.
Demonstrated ability in testing mobile applications for both iOS and Android platforms across variety of devices.
Solid experience in writing detailed documentation/tickets using tools like Jira & Confluence.
Work well in an agile/scrum development environment.
Excellent communication skills and the ability to have fun in a small team environment.
Nice to haves
1. QA Automation experience.
2. Experience in a growth stage company/startup.
3. Familiarity with automation tools like Selenium, Postman, Python or equivalent.
4. Ability to perform SQL Database queries.

6. Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent demonstrated ability.

We're looking for a QA Engineer. Headquartered in Los Angeles, California, Right Balance applies the latest technology and best engineering practices to help businesses grow. We’re in the top 50 companies to watch in LA.

## Engagement Details

We're a fast growing fintech company that's transforming the financial advice industry. Our mission is to make financial advice better, more affordable, and accessible to everyone. We’re a modern custodian built exclusively for registered investment advisors (RIAs). As we disrupt legacy custodians and revolutionize the $100T RIA market, we're seeking exceptional individuals to join our team. If you embody our core values of kindness, brilliance, and grit, and are passionate about making a meaningful impact, we want to hear from you!

Continuing to build and evolve our automation framework using Selenium for the UI automation, we use Spring Boot for backend test automation as well with most of its features. Our backend API is also in Java / Spring Boot, so you'll start understanding the backend code too. We're committed to innovation, constantly putting together new POCs and testing new approaches to make things even better.

## What’s in it for you

1\. Learn and evolve your skills using the latest and greatest technology tools in a rapidly growing company

2\. Learn from the best engineers. We constantly challenge the status quo and invent new ways of building a great product.

3\. Flexible hours. Just join daily standups, sprint planning, and retrospective meetings. Other than that you’re in control of your own schedule

4\. 100% remote. Work anywhere, whether it is remotely in the comfort of your home, in a shared co-working space, in an RV on the beach, or while being a nomad in another country.

5\. Work on challenging problems, innovate, impacting lots of people's lives for the better while having fun doing it.

## Required Qualifications

- Upper-intermediate to fluent speaking and writing English. Able to have a real-time conversation.

- 4+ years of hands-on full-time QA Engineer experience.

- 2+ years of hands-on full-time experience with QA Manual.

- 2+ years of hands-on full-time experience with QA Automation.

- 2+ years of hands-on full-time experience with Selenium.

- 2+ years of hands-on full-time experience with Java.

- UI automation experience.

- API automation experience.

- Experience working in a fast paced environment.

- Willingness to take ownership of the release process and performing releases is required.

## Nice to haves

1\. Financial domain knowledge.

2\. DevOps release related experience.

3\. Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent demonstrated ability.

## Frequently Asked Questions

>_What are your typical clients?_

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups at the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company already achieved a product-market fit and is looking to expand rapidly. Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years so you are able to evolve your career with the company you are currently working in.

The Right Balance team is 60+ engineers going to 100 by the end of the year. The current client size team is 450+ people. The timing is great to be a part of a rapidly growing team making meaningful contributions.

Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current engagement is ramping down, we’ll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.

Client First: we only win when our clients win. We treat client challenges as our own.

Ownership: we embrace responsibility, taking on challenges, getting them to completion, and enjoying getting things done.

Quality: we’re passionate about achieving quality outcomes by applying meticulous attention to detail.

## Overview
We're looking for a QA Engineer. Headquartered in Los Angeles, California, Right Balance applies the latest technology and best engineering practices to help businesses grow. We’re in the top 50 companies to watch in LA.

## Engagement Details

Text messaging adoption is growing rapidly. Now, an average person spends 23 hours a week texting. Our product is a text messaging automation software platform allowing E-Commerce store owners to do most of their customer communication over text messaging as opposed to old-school calls and emails.

The technology stack is React.js on the front end with Redux Saga, Storybooks, slick-looking UI with a custom design system, and an AI-powered conversation builder using the Canvas API. 

The front end is powered by Python / Django backend API on top of a PostgreSQL database with Kafka processing high throughput text messages at the scale of 10s of millions of messages per day. Soon we’ll be adding NoSQL and Kubernetes into the mix.

We're rebuilding our segmentation services, perfecting the product, dramatically expanding our 3rd party services integrations. Join us, it’ll be a lot of fun!

## What’s in it for you

1\. Learn and evolve your skills using the latest and greatest technology tools in a rapidly growing company.

2\. Learn from the best engineers. We constantly challenge the status quo and invent new ways of building a great product.

3\. Flexible hours. Just join daily standups, sprint planning, and retrospective meetings. Other than that you’re in control of your own schedule.

4\. 100% remote. Work anywhere, whether it is remotely in the comfort of your home, in a shared co-working space, in an RV on the beach, or while being a nomad in another country.

5\. Work on challenging problems, innovate, impacting lots of people's lives for the better while having fun doing it.

## Required Qualifications

- 4+ years of hands-on full-time experience as a QA Engineer.
  
- 2+ years of hands-on full-time experience with QA Automation.

- 2+ years of hands-on full-time experience with Manual QA.

- 1+ years of hands-on full-time experience with Cypress (or TestCafe, or similar JS testing framework).

- Upper-intermediate to fluent speaking and writing English. Able to have a real-time conversation.

- Experience with web app testing.

- API testing experience using tools like Postman or similar.

- Strong knowledge in Design Patterns in Test Automation.

- Familiarity with Agile Software Development Lifecycle.

- Proactive communication, being able to gather requirements and accomplish things without much supervision or guidence.

## Nice to haves

1\. SQL experience.

2\. Python experience.

3\. TestRail experience.

4\. AWS experience.

5\. Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent demonstrated ability.

## Frequently Asked Questions

>_What are your typical clients?_

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups at the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company already achieved a product-market fit and is looking to expand rapidly. That’s where we bring the best engineering practices, strong architecture, and the latest technologies to help companies scale.

>_What is the length of your engagements?_

Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years so you are able to evolve your career with the company you are currently working in.

>_What’s your company size?_

The Right Balance team is 60+ engineers going to 100 by the end of the year. The current client size team is 93+ people. The timing is great to be a part of a rapidly growing team making meaningful contributions.

>_What happens if the engagement is completed?_

Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current engagement is ramping down, we’ll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.

>_What are your core values?_

Client First: we only win when our clients win. We treat client challenges as our own.

Ownership: we embrace responsibility, taking on challenges, getting them to completion, and enjoying getting things done.

Quality: we’re passionate about achieving quality outcomes by applying meticulous attention to detail.

_data.title: QA Manual Engineer

children.value: Overview

We're looking for a QA Manual Engineer to join our team. Headquartered in Los Angeles, California, Right Balance applies the latest technology and the best engineering practices to help businesses grow. We’re in the top 50 companies to watch in LA.
Project Details
Our client is a leading software solutions provider in the online advertising market. The platform streamlines the ad sales processes for some of the most prominent publishers on the Web.

We’re committed to continuous innovation by using the latest technologies in the cloud arena. We’re moving to microservices, optimizing the flow of data in the AdTech stack to connect publishers and advertisers in a meaningful way.

You'll be working with a large scale system involving a lot of features, working with terabytes of data in our database. Performance is important for our team, as well as scalability. Constantly challenging the status quo, we're always improving our processes. Your voice will be heard.
You'll make an impact on the team by utilizing your technological experience.

Our stack is .NET on the backend, moving to .NET Core with SQL Server deployed to Azure Cloud. On the frontend, we’re using Vue.js. Our release pipeline is streamlined with CI/CD running on Azure pipelines. For our infrastructure, we believe in managing it as code, currently using Terraform to do so. Some of our services use Azure functions, as well as running in containers on Kubernetes. Having a lot of fun doing it, join us!
What’s in it for you
1. Work with the latest and greatest technologies.
2. Learn from the best people. We constantly challenge the status quo, learn from each other, and invent new ways of building a great product.
3. We actually write automated tests. We take advantage of the latest automation tools like automatic deployments, CI/CD pipelines, and more.
4. Work remotely at the comfort of your home or a shared co-working space.
5. Work on challenging problems, innovate, have fun while doing it.
6. Travel around the world. We offer occasional business trips to work with our clients face to face from their offices.
Required Qualifications
1. 2+ years of professional full-time QA experience.
2. 1+ years of professional SQL experience.
3. Upper-intermediate to fluent speaking and writing English.
4. Basic understanding of SDLC.
5. Basic understanding of QA strategy.
6. Basic understanding of quality test cycle.
7. Experience creating and documenting test cases.
8. Strong analytical abilities.
9. Familiarity with automated testing and how it works together with the QA strategy.
10. Solid troubleshooting skills..
Nice to haves
1. A formal Computer Science or equivalent degree.
2. Zephyr experience.
3. CI/CD system experience (we use Azure Pipelines).
4. Cloud experience (preferably Azure).
5. API Testing experience with Postman(SOAP and Rest).
6. Selenium or equivalent experience.
7. Software development experience.
Frequently Asked Questions
What are your typical clients?

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups at the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company already achieved a product-market fit and is looking to expand rapidly. That’s where we bring the best engineering practices, strong architecture, and the latest technologies to help companies scale.
What is the length of your projects?
Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years.
What’s your company size?

The Right Balance team is 10 - 15 engineers. The current client team size is 30 engineers expanding to 50 engineers by the end of this year . It’s exciting to be a part of this growth making some meaningful contributions.
What happens if the engagement is completed?
Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current project is ramping down, we’ll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.
What are your core values?

We value autonomy, grind, empathy, mastery, and giving back to the community. We expect you to be autonomous, working directly with the client to build the best product. We value hard work, helping each other, constant learning as well as open-source contributions, and knowledge sharing.

You’ll help to build scalable, robust, solutions that provide a smooth customer experience. You’ll be responsible for the design, development, delivery and support of large-scale, multi-tier distributed software applications and tools.

Innovate with us and showcase your work to millions of users across the United States. The technology stack includes a Kubernetes microservice environment, each service with a separate PostgreSQL datastore. We use Kafka to communicate between our microservices written in Ruby on Rails and Go serving 10 million events per month. The backend powers our web and mobile applications written in the latest React.js and React Native. We’re following the best practices on the frontend using Redux Toolkit, Redux, Zustand, Next.js, TypeScript, and latest post hooks React. Also, Cypress & Jest testing. Join us, it’ll be fun!

## **_What’s in it for you_**

1. Learn and evolve your skills using the latest and greatest technology tools in a rapidly growing company.
2. Learn from the best engineers. We constantly challenge the status quo and invent new ways of building a great product.
3. Flexible hours. Just join daily standups, sprint planning, and retrospective meetings. Other than that you’re in control of your own schedule.
4. 100% remote. Work anywhere, whether it is remotely at the comfort of your home, in a shared co-working space, in an RV on the beach or while being a nomad in another country.
5. Work on challenging problems, innovate, impacting lots of people's lives for the better while having fun doing it.

## **_Required Qualifications_**

1. 4+ years of full-time hands-on coding experience.
2. 3+ years of full-time hands-on work experience with React.
3. Upper-intermediate to fluent level of verbal English.
4. Passion for building top-notch software applications and tools.
5. CSSproficiency.
6. Passionforbuildingtop-notchsoftwareapplicationsandtools.
7. UnittestingexperiencewithJestorsimilar.
8. Customerexperiencemindset-greatoverallallunderstandingandknowledgeofhow the UI will be used.
9. Communicationskillsthatestablishtrust-Proactivecommunication.
10. Experience working with other engineers within a team and across teams - team player, proactiveness, working directly with PM and the rest of the team.
11. Thrives in being an individual contributor, loves writing code and delivery focused.
12. Ability to design, develop, test, deploy, maintain and improve software as well as build new product features.
13. SDLC - test your code - deploy your stuff - know when refactor when not to
14. Experience managing individual project priorities, deadlines and deliverables - working with product on priorities, communicating and managing time effectively, getting stuff done on time, low maintenance, and self sufficient. 
15. Ability to estimate features accurately.

## **_Nice to haves_**

1. ReduxToolkitexperience.
2. ExperiencewithendtoendtestingwithCypressorsimilar.
3. Next.jsexperience.
4.ProficiencyandclearunderstandingoffunctionalprogrammingusingJavascript, component composability.
5. Experiencewithperformanceoptimizations.

## **_Frequently Asked Questions_**

> **_What are your typical clients?_**

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups in the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company already achieved a product-market fit and is looking to expand rapidly. That’s where we bring the best engineering practices, strong architecture, and the latest technologies to help companies scale.

> **_What is the length of your engagements?_**

Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years so you are able to grow your career with the company you are currently working in.

> **_What’s your company size?_**

The Right Balance team has 60+ engineers going to 100+ by the end of the year. It’s exciting to be a part of a solid engineering team making meaningful contributions.

> **_What happens if the engagement is completed?_**

Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current engagement is ramping down, we’ll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.

> **_What are your core values?_**

* Client First: we only win when our clients win. We treat client challenges as our own.
* Ownership: we embrace responsibility, taking on challenges, getting them to completion, and enjoying getting things done.
* Quality: we’re passionate about achieving quality outcomes by applying meticulous attention to detail.

_data.text:
## Overview

We're looking for a strong React engineer. Headquartered in Los Angeles, California, Right Balance applies the latest technology and the best engineering practices to help businesses grow. We’re in the top 50 companies to watch in LA.

## Project Details

Our client is changing the way consumers purchase and get support for new technology. Is the leading independent, nationwide on-demand technology support platform that provides affordable, same-day on-site and 24/7 online tech support services. Utilizes a network of thousands of independent technicians throughout the US that are hand-selected, vetted, and background-checked to provide a top-notch customer experience for a wide range of services, including computer support, smart home device installation, home office setup, and product sales.

You’ll help to build scalable, robust, rock-solid solutions that provide a smooth customer experience. You’ll be responsible for the design, development, delivery, and support oflarge-scale, multi-tier distributed software applications and tools.

Innovate with us and showcase your work to millions of users across the United States. The technology stack includes a Kubernetes microservice environment, each service with a separate PostgreSQL datastore. We use Kafka to communicate between our microservices written in Ruby on Rails and Go serving 10 million events per month. The backend powers our web and mobile applications written in the latest React.js and React Native. We’re following the best practices on the frontend using Redux Toolkit, Redux, Zustand, Next.js, TypeScript, and latest post hooks React. Also, Cypress & Jest testing. Join us, it’ll be fun!

## What’s in it for you

1. Work with the latest and greatest technologies.
2. Learn from the best people. We constantly challenge the status quo, learn from each other, and invent new ways of building a great product.
3. We actually write automated tests. We take advantage of the latest automation tools like automatic deployments, CI/CD pipelines, and more.
4. Flexible hours. Just join daily standups, sprint planning, and retrospective meetings. Other than that you’re in control of your own schedule.
5. Work remotely at the comfort of your home or a shared co-working space.
6. Work on challenging problems, innovate, have fun while doing it.
7. Travel around the world. We offer occasional business trips to work with our clients face to face from their offices.

## Required Qualifications

 1. 4+ years of full-time hands-on coding experience.
 2. 2+ years of full-time hands-on work experience with React.
 3. Upper-intermediate to fluent level of verbal English.
 4. Passion for building top-notch software applications and tools.
 5. Unit testing experience with Jest or similar.
 6. Customer experience mindset. Clear understanding how the UI will be used.
 7. Proactive communication skills.
 8. Experience working with other engineers within a team and across teams.
 9. Thrives in being an individual contributor, loves writing code and delivery focused.
10. Ability to design, develop, test, deploy, maintain and improve software as well as build new product features.
11. Experience managing individual project priorities, deadlines, and deliverables.
12. Ability to estimate features accurately.

## Nice to haves

1. Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or related technical field.
2. Redux Toolkit experience.
3. Experience with end to end testing using Cypress or similar.
4. Next.js experience.
5. Proficiency and clear understanding of functional programming using Javascript,component composability.
6. Experience with performance optimizations.
7. Big O notation.

## Frequently Asked Questions

> What are your typical clients?

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups at the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company already achieved a product-market fit and is looking to expand rapidly. That’s where we bring the best engineering practices, strong architecture, and the latest technologies to help companies scale.

> What is the length of your projects?

Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years.

> What’s your company size?

The Right Balance team is 30+ engineers looking to double in the next 12 months. The current client size team is 80+ engineers and more than 325 employees in total.

> What happens if the engagement is completed?

Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current project is ramping down, we’ll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.

> What are your core values?

We value autonomy, grind, empathy, mastery, and giving back to the community. We expect you to be autonomous, working directly with the client to build the best product. We value hard work, helping each other, constant learning as well as open-source contributions, and knowledge sharing.

## Overview
We're looking for a React Native Engineer. Headquartered in Los Angeles, California, Right Balance applies the latest technology and best engineering practices to help businesses grow. We’re in the top 50 companies to watch in LA.

## Engagement Details

Our client is a fast-paced, high-growth startup, committed to transforming a $30-billion industry through our all-in-one platform. Leveraging the latest technology, we’re taking commercial contractors from the world of pen and paper operations to digitized, efficient, data-driven business.

The co-founders have over a decade of experience in both construction and SaaS technology, as well as a resume that includes Stanford, Harvard, Wharton, Cornell, Microsoft, and multiple successful startup exits, including a $1.2 billion acquisition.

Our client has raised multiple rounds of funding from some of the largest and most reputable Venture Capital firms, including Founders Fund, Fika Ventures, and Greenspring Associates.

Our engineering team is distributed across Los Angeles, Toronto, and Latin America. As a pioneering member of the team, your primary focus will be to help continue to build the product from the ground up. We are looking for a motivated, self-starter who can work in a distributed team environment. This is a hands-on role. The day-to-day responsibilities are broad, and you will ultimately be responsible for shipping software

Our frontend is in React Native and React.js, the backend is in Node.js, so get your Javascript on! Solve interesting challenges in a rapid growth environment. We have greenfield development of new product modules using the latest tools and frameworks. Come join us, it’ll be fun!

## What’s in it for you

1\. Learn and evolve your skills using the latest and greatest technology tools in a rapidly growing company

2\. Learn from the best engineers. We constantly challenge the status quo and invent new ways of building a great product.

3\. Flexible hours. Just join daily standups, sprint planning, and retrospective meetings. Other than that you’re in control of your own schedule

4\. 100% remote. Work anywhere, whether it is remotely in the comfort of your home, in a shared co-working space, in an RV on the beach, or while being a nomad in another country.

5\. Work on challenging problems, innovate, impacting lots of people's lives for the better while having fun doing it.

## Required Qualifications

1\. 7+ years of full-time hands-on Software Engineering experience.

2\. 5+ years of full-time hands-on experience in React Native.

3\. Upper-intermediate to fluent speaking and writing English. Able to have a real-time conversation.

4\. Unit testing experience.

5\. Experience working in startups.

6\. Proactive communication.

7\. Ability to gather requirement details and accomplish things without much supervision or guidance.

## Nice to haves

1\. Backend experience.

2\. Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent demonstrated ability.

## Frequently Asked Questions

>_What are your typical clients?_

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups in the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company already achieved a product-market fit and is looking to expand rapidly. That’s where we bring the best engineering practices, strong architecture, and the latest technologies to help companies scale.

>_What is the length of your engagements?_

Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years so you are able to evolve your career with the company you are currently working in.

>_What’s your company size?_

The Right Balance team is 60+ engineers going to 200 by the end of the year. The current client size team is 150+ people. The timing is great to be a part of a rapidly growing team making meaningful contributions.

>_What happens if the engagement is completed?_

Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current engagement is ramping down, we’ll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.

>_What are your core values?_

Client First: we only win when our clients win. We treat client challenges as our own.

Ownership: we embrace responsibility, taking on challenges, getting them to completion, and enjoying getting things done.

Quality: we’re passionate about achieving quality outcomes by applying meticulous attention to detail.

_data.text:
## **_Overview_**

We're looking for a strong Ruby on Rails engineer. Headquartered in Los Angeles, California, Right Balance applies the latest technology and the best engineering practices to help businesses grow. We’re in the top 50 companies to watch in LA.

## **_Project Details_**

Our client is changing the way consumers purchase and get support for new technology. Is the leading independent, nationwide on-demand technology support platform that provides affordable, same-day on-site and 24/7 online tech support services. Utilizes a network of thousands of independent technicians throughout the US that are hand-selected, vetted, and background-checked to provide a top-notch customer experience for a wide range of services, including computer support, smart home device installation, home office setup, and product sales.

You’ll help to build scalable, robust, rock-solid solutions that provide a smooth customer experience. You’ll be responsible for the design, development, delivery, and support of large-scale, multi-tier distributed software applications and tools.

Innovate with us and showcase your work to millions of users across the United States. The technology stack includes **Kubernetes** microservice environment, each service with a separate **PostgreSQL** datastore. We use **Kafka** to communicate between our **microservices** written in **Ruby on Rails** and **Go**. Our system serves **10 million events per month**. Join us, it’ll be fun!

## **_What’s in it for you_**

1. Work with the latest and greatest technologies.
2. Learn from the best people. We constantly challenge the status quo, learn from each other, and invent new ways of building a great product.
3. We actually write automated tests. We take advantage of the latest automation tools like automatic deployments, CI/CD pipelines, and more.
4. Flexible hours. Just join daily standups, sprint planning, and retrospective meetings. Other than that you’re in control of your own schedule.
5. Work remotely at the comfort of your home or a shared co-working space.
6. Work on challenging problems, innovate, have fun while doing it.
7. Travel around the world. We offer occasional business trips to work with our clients face to face from their offices.

## **_Required Qualifications_**

1. 2+ years of full-time hands-on work experience in **Rails**.
2. 4+ years of full-time hands-on work experience as a Back End Developer.
3. Passion for building top-notch software applications and tools.
4. Customer experience mindset.
5. Proactive communication skills.
6. Experience working with other engineers within a team and across teams.
7. Ability to take product requirements and develop software architectures and designs.
8. Ability to design, develop, test, deploy, maintain and improve the software as well as build new product features.
9. Experience managing individual project priorities, deadlines, and deliverables.

## **_Nice to haves_**

1. Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science or related technical field.
2. Interest and ability to learn other coding languages as needed.
3. Experience in Software Development in one or more general-purpose programming languages including but not limited to: C/C++, Java, Python, JavaScript, Go, Rust, Objective-C and/or Swift.
4. Experience with automated testing.
5. Big O notation.

## **_Frequently Asked Questions_**

> **_What are your typical clients?_**

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups in the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company already achieved a product-market fit and is looking to expand rapidly. That’s where we bring the best engineering practices, strong architecture, and the latest technologies to help companies scale.

> **_What is the length of your engagements?_**

Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years so you are able to grow your career with the company you are currently working in.

> **_What’s your company size?_**

The Right Balance team has 60+ engineers going to 100+ by the end of the year. It’s exciting to be a part of a solid engineering team making meaningful contributions.

> **_What happens if the engagement is completed?_**

Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current engagement is ramping down, we’ll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.

> **_What are your core values?_**

* Client First: we only win when our clients win. We treat client challenges as our own.
* Ownership: we embrace responsibility, taking on challenges, getting them to completion, and enjoying getting things done.
* Quality: we’re passionate about achieving quality outcomes by applying meticulous attention to detail.

children.value: Overview

We're looking for a strong Software Development Engineer in Test with Ruby. Headquartered in Los Angeles, California, Right Balance applies the latest technology and the best engineering practices to help businesses grow. We’re in the top 50 companies to watch in LA.
Project Details

Our client is the largest technology company focused on member engagement for healthcare organizations helping them to connect people to health. By using behavioral research, data science, and adaptive multi-channel platform, they deliver personalization at scale for the most trusted healthcare organizations in all 50 states in the USA, including seven of the 10 largest health plans.

With cutting-edge technologies like AWS, Python, Kotlin, Spring Boot, Typescript, React, and Node.js implementing features test first, believing in strong CI/CD principles, the company is building a great engineering culture where you’ll be thriving and constantly learning new things. We’re a solid team of entrepreneurs with previous startup success. The current product is integrated with Machine Learning and AI. We’re using event-driven architecture on the backend with microservices serving millions of people every year and sending tens of thousands of messages every hour. Join us, it won’t be boring!
What’s in it for you
Work with the latest and greatest technologies.
Learn from the best people. We constantly challenge the status quo, learn from each other, and invent new ways of building a great product.
We actually write automated tests. We take advantage of the latest automation tools like automatic deployments, CI/CD pipelines, and more.
Flexible hours. Just join daily standups, sprint planning, and retrospective meetings. Other than that you’re in control of your own schedule.
Work remotely at the comfort of your home or a shared co-working space.
Work on challenging problems, innovate, have fun while doing it.
Travel around the world. We offer occasional business trips to work with our clients face to face from their offices.
Required Qualifications
2+ years of full-time hands-on experience in a professional setting doing QA automation.
1+ years of software development experience.
Upper-intermediate to fluent speaking and writing English.
Professional hands-on experience with Ruby and Cucumber or RSpec.
Experience developing and writing queries for RDBMS and NoSQL databases.
Experience with source control GitHub or similar.
Experience working with Agile methodologies and cross-functional teams.
Hands-on experience with JSON data structures.
Strong communication and collaboration skills, being able to communicate across all levels of the organization.
Passionate about well-crafted, high-quality code that is built to scale.
Create systems and automated tests to ensure the quality of our platform.
Write clear, concise Test Cases.
Identify, record, document thoroughly, track bugs, create and perform thorough regression tests.
Participate in the monitoring of our standard quality metrics.
Apply an engineering mindset and follow best practices established by the team to ensure quality and timely delivery. A continuous deployment mindset.
Stay up-to-date with new testing tools and test strategies.
Someone who thrives in a faced pace evolving company and is able to embrace change to drive the product forward.
Nice to haves
Experience with AWS Lambda (or GCP Cloud Functions, or Azure Functions, or similar).
SQL experience.
NoSQL experience with Mongo or similar.
1+ year of DevOps experience
Deep understanding of automated testing, ability to set up automated testing frameworks, testing architecture, data seeding, mocking, and implementing best testing practices.
Knowledge of Runtime and memory complexity using Big O notation.
Technical leadership experience.
Team management experience.
Open-source contributions, presentations, and publications.
Frequently Asked Questions
What are your typical clients?

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups at the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company already achieved a product-market fit and is looking to expand rapidly. That’s where we bring the best engineering practices, strong architecture, and the latest technologies to help companies scale.
What is the length of your projects?
Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years.
What’s your company size?
The Right Balance team is 30+ engineers looking to double in the next 12 months. The current client size team is 80+ engineers and more than 325 employees in total.
What happens if the engagement is completed?
Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current project is ramping down, we’ll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.
What are your core values?

We value autonomy, grind, empathy, mastery, and giving back to the community. We expect you to be autonomous, working directly with the client to build the best product. We value hard work, helping each other, constant learning as well as open-source contributions, and knowledge sharing.

_data.title: senior Senior Backend Engineer

children.value: Overview

We're looking for a Senior Backend Engineer. Headquartered in Los Angeles, California, Right Balance applies the latest technology and best engineering practices to help businesses grow. We’re in the top 50 companies to watch in LA.
Engagement Details

Our client is building a career platform for employees and recruiters built on the principles of data openness, quantitative evaluation, and self-improvement. The core of the platform is a data augmentation and analytics layer that helps users visualize an individual’s “human capital” with a single, intelligible score. A user's score quantifies their work experience and education, and is further enriched by proprietary data signals to provide a holistic ranking of professionals in the same functional role. Our goal is to help all users understand how everyone “stacks up” without having to parse individual resumes or LinkedIn profiles and ask for referrals or recommendations.

Our company has raised $26M to date–-although we are still pre-product. We have a remote global engineering team of 7 at the moment. Company leadership is based in Los Angeles. We are a fast moving startup that takes pride in a fast iteration style and transparency. We want to work with high-energy do-ers with heavy bias for action.

## Overview
We're looking for a Senior Backend Engineer. Headquartered in Los Angeles, California, Right Balance applies the latest technology and best engineering practices to help businesses grow. We’re in the top 50 companies to watch in LA.

## Engagement Details

Our client is building a career platform for employees and recruiters built on the principles of data openness, quantitative evaluation, and self-improvement. The core of the platform is a data augmentation and analytics layer that helps users visualize an individual’s “human capital” with a single, intelligible score. A user's score quantifies their work experience and education, and is further enriched by proprietary data signals to provide a holistic ranking of professionals in the same functional role. Our goal is to help all users understand how everyone “stacks up” without having to parse individual resumes or LinkedIn profiles and ask for referrals or recommendations.

Our company has raised $26M to date–-although we are still pre-product. We have a remote global engineering team of 7 at the moment. Company leadership is based in Los Angeles. We are a fast moving startup that takes pride in a fast iteration style and transparency. We want to work with high-energy do-ers with heavy bias for action.

The backend API is built with Node.js using Nest.js framework. The frontend is React based using Next.js. It’s a green field project with no legacy code. Our data pipeline processes a large amount of data using Python running on AWS. Come join us, it’ll be fun!

## What’s in it for you

1\. Learn and evolve your skills using the latest and greatest technology tools in a rapidly growing company

2\. Learn from the best engineers. We constantly challenge the status quo and invent new ways of building a great product.

3\. Flexible hours. Just join daily standups, sprint planning, and retrospective meetings. Other than that you’re in control of your own schedule

4\. 100% remote. Work anywhere, whether it is remotely in the comfort of your home, in a shared co-working space, in an RV on the beach, or while being a nomad in another country.

5\. Work on challenging problems, innovate, impacting lots of people's lives for the better while having fun doing it.

## Required Qualifications

1\. 7+ years of full-time hands-on software engineering experience.

2\. Upper-intermediate to fluent speaking and writing English. Able to have a real-time conversation.

3\. 3+ years of Nest.js backend experience (or 1+ years of Nest.js and 2+ years of Java / Spring or Go).

4\. 1+ years of full-time hands-on experience with Typescript.

5\. 1+ years of full-time hands-on experience with PostgreSQL.

6\. Experience building scalable, consumer-grade APIs.

7\. Previous experience working in a team larger than 2 people. 

8\. Collaborative with focus on iterative approach to problem solving.

9\. Real microservices experience (separate DBs, queues, pub/sub, etc).

10\. Caching experience.

11\. Experience building complex, data-driven solutions.

12\. Experience as a tech lead or high ownership ability.

13\. Experience working in startups.

## Nice to haves

1\. Automated testing.

2\. 1+ years of full-time hands-on Nest.js experience.

3\. Experience with TDD and/or Integration testing (API level).

4\. GraphQL experience.

5\. Elastic Search experience.

## Frequently Asked Questions

>_What are your typical clients?_

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups in the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company already achieved a product-market fit and is looking to expand rapidly. That’s where we bring the best engineering practices, strong architecture, and the latest technologies to help companies scale.

>_What is the length of your engagements?_

Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years so you are able to evolve your career with the company you are currently working in.

>_What’s your company size?_

The Right Balance team is 60+ engineers going to 200 by the end of the year. The current client size team is 150+ people. The timing is great to be a part of a rapidly growing team making meaningful contributions.

>_What happens if the engagement is completed?_

Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current engagement is ramping down, we’ll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.

>_What are your core values?_

Client First: we only win when our clients win. We treat client challenges as our own.

Ownership: we embrace responsibility, taking on challenges, getting them to completion, and enjoying getting things done.

Quality: we’re passionate about achieving quality outcomes by applying meticulous attention to detail.

## Overview
We're looking for a Senior Backend Software Engineer. Headquartered in Los Angeles, California, Right Balance applies the latest technology and best engineering practices to help businesses grow. We’re in the top 50 companies to watch in LA.

## Engagement Details

Senior Backend Software Engineer will work with business development, data, and product teams to solve tough problems and challenges through development and automation. Our team culture is a unique combination of structured vision and process maturity. In this role, you will be developing innovative cloud-based backend solutions and support current integrations, including deploying integration components in development/production environments.

We’re using Serverless (AWS Lambda & API Gateway), Node.js, MongoDB on the backend, Angular on the frontend. Transmitting 5TB of data per month between all Kiosk devices. Come join us, it won’t be boring!

Come join us, it’ll be fun!

## What’s in it for you

1\. Learn and evolve your skills using the latest and greatest technology tools in a rapidly growing company

2\. Learn from the best engineers. We constantly challenge the status quo and invent new ways of building a great product.

3\. Flexible hours. Just join daily standups, sprint planning, and retrospective meetings. Other than that you’re in control of your own schedule

4\. 100% remote. Work anywhere, whether it is remotely in the comfort of your home, in a shared co-working space, in an RV on the beach, or while being a nomad in another country.

5\. Work on challenging problems, innovate, impacting lots of people's lives for the better while having fun doing it.

## Required Qualifications

1\. 10+ years of full-time hands-on Backend Engineering experience.

2\. Upper-intermediate to fluent speaking and writing English. Able to have a real-time conversation.

3\. 7+ years of full-time hands-on Node.js experience.

4\. 4+ years of full-time hands-on MongoDB experience.

5\. 2+ years of full-time hands-on AWS experience.

6\. Experience developing Cloud applications with API management and distributed microservices based architecture.

7\. Experience with data modeling and patterns using NoSQL database technology.

8\. Strong knowledge JavaScript, ES6+.

9\. Serverless / AWS Lambda experience.

10\. Ability to challenge and improve the underlying technology stack.


## Nice to haves

1\. Willingness to perform all other related duties as required.

2\. Experience or burning desire to work with TypeScript.

3\. Ability to drive performance tuning, automation, monitoring, and testability.

4\. Frontend experience.

5\. Ability to reason through problems to reach solutions and troubleshoot.

6\. Serverless / AWS Lambda experience.


## Frequently Asked Questions

>_What are your typical clients?_

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups in the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company already achieved a product-market fit and is looking to expand rapidly. That’s where we bring the best engineering practices, strong architecture, and the latest technologies to help companies scale.

>_What is the length of your engagements?_

Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years so you are able to evolve your career with the company you are currently working in.

>_What’s your company size?_

The Right Balance team is 60+ engineers going to 200 by the end of the year. The current client size team is 150+ people. The timing is great to be a part of a rapidly growing team making meaningful contributions.

>_What happens if the engagement is completed?_

Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current engagement is ramping down, we’ll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.

>_What are your core values?_

Client First: we only win when our clients win. We treat client challenges as our own.

Ownership: we embrace responsibility, taking on challenges, getting them to completion, and enjoying getting things done.

Quality: we’re passionate about achieving quality outcomes by applying meticulous attention to detail.

Our client is building a career platform for employees and recruiters built on the principles of data openness, quantitative evaluation, and self-improvement. 5. Work on challenging problems, innovate, impacting lots of people's lives for the better while having fun doing it.

## **_Required Qualifications_**

1. 4+ years of full-time hands-on Data Engineering experience.
2. Upper-intermediate to fluent speaking and writing English. Able to have a real-time conversation.
3. 2+ Python experience.
4. Experience with data pipelines and data warehousing using AWS.
5. Experience using PostgreSQL, Python, Pandas.
6. Enthusiastic about solving difficult problems as we find product market fit.
7. Ability to work autonomously.
8. Bias towards action and desire to work in a fast paced environment.

## **_Nice to haves_**

1. Experience and interest in developing Neural Networks or Machine Learning models.
2. Apache Airflow experience.
3. Experience with data normalization of scrapped datasets.
4. Experience building social platforms.

## **_Frequently Asked Questions_**

> **_What are your typical clients?_**

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups in the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company already achieved a product-market fit and is looking to expand rapidly. Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years so you are able to grow your career with the company you are currently working in.
