The Right Balance team is 60+ engineers going to 200+ by the end of 2023. The current client size team is 50 people. It’s exciting to be a part of the solid engineering team making meaningful contributions.

> **_What happens if the engagement is completed?_**

Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current engagement is ramping down, we’ll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.

> **_What are your core values?_**

* Client First: we only win when our clients win. We treat client challenges as our own.
* Ownership: we embrace responsibility, taking on challenges, getting them to completion, and enjoying getting things done.
* Quality: we’re passionate about achieving quality outcomes by applying meticulous attention to detail.

_data.title: Senior Data Engineer

children.value: Overview

We're looking for a strong senior-level data engineer. Headquartered in Los Angeles, California, Right Balance applies the latest technology and the best engineering practices to help businesses grow. We’re in the top 50 companies to watch in LA.
Engagement Details

Our client is the customer intelligence partner that empowers businesses to maximize customer-level profitability. The team (former Facebook, PayPal, and Stanford alums) has built a product that can predict individual customer lifetime value at the earliest point of customer contact and changed how brands view their relationships with their customer. Using data science to predict future buying behavior of consumers and recommend actions that businesses can take around those predictions.

As a Senior Data Engineer, you will be working closely with an AI technology leader and seasoned hands-on multi-startup CTO with over 15 years of experience to leverage the best technologies and techniques to build out DataOps. That is to automate fast, available, and accurate data to super-charge the data science delivered to clients like Dollar Shave Club, Nestlé, Madison Reed, and Capital One. If you are a self-starter focused on results that loves automating via code, are comfortable with AWS services, and have had experience with Big Data systems, join us!
What’s in it for you

1. Work with the latest and greatest technologies for a venture-backed startup. 2. Learn from the best people. We constantly challenge the status quo, learn from each other, and invent new ways of building a great product.
3. We actually write automated tests. We take advantage of the latest automation tools like automatic deployments, CI/CD pipelines, and more.
4. Flexible hours. Just join daily standups, sprint planning, and retrospective meetings. Other than that you’re in control of your own schedule.
5. Work remotely at the comfort of your home or a shared co-working space. 6. Work on challenging problems, innovate, have fun while doing it.
7. Travel around the world. We offer occasional business trips to work with our clients face to face from their offices.
Required Qualifications
1. 4+ years of full-time hands-on data engineering experience.
2. 3+ years of SQL databases and big data experience.
3. 2+ years of cloud infrastructure experience (AWS, Google Cloud, Azure).
4. 2+ years of Python experience.
5. 2+ years of Apache Spark experience.
6. Able to have a conversation about technical details speaking and writing English in real time.
7. Experience in at least one big data relational database technology such as Snowflake, Cassandra, Redshift, BigQuery.
8. Experience with PySpark.
Nice to haves
1. Bachelors or Masters in Engineering, Computer Science, or related technical degree.
2. Experience working with big data and/or marketing data applications.
3. Databricks experience.
4. Experience with working extensively in AWS.
Nice to haves
1. Bachelors or Masters in Engineering, Computer Science, or related technical degree.
2. Experience working with big data and/or marketing data applications.
3. Databricks experience.
4. Experience with working extensively in AWS.
Frequently Asked Questions
What are your typical clients?

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups at the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company already achieved a product-market fit and is looking to expand rapidly. That’s where we bring the best engineering practices, strong architecture, and the latest technologies to help companies scale.
What is the length of your projects?
Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years.
What’s your company size?

The Right Balance team is 10 - 15 engineers. The current client team size is 30 engineers expanding to 50 engineers by the end of this year . It’s exciting to be a part of this growth making some meaningful contributions.
What happens if the engagement is completed?
Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current project is ramping down, we’ll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.
What are your core values?

We value autonomy, grind, empathy, mastery, and giving back to the community. We expect you to be autonomous, working directly with the client to build the best product. We value hard work, helping each other, constant learning, open-source contributions, and knowledge sharing.

We're looking for a robust Senior Data Engineer to join our team. Headquartered in Los Angeles, California, Right Balance applies the latest technology and best engineering practices to help businesses grow. We’re in the top 50 companies to watch in LA.
Engagement Details

We are a leading independent, on-demand technology support service. Available 24/7 both in-home and remote, our company has a massive network of expert technicians nationwide dedicated to providing a top-notch customer experience for a wide range of services, including computer support, smart home device installation, home office setup, and more.
With both direct-to-consumer presence and deep integrations with retailers such as Walmart.com and Comcast Xfinity, we eliminate the headaches and hassle of product installation and maintenance.
We're seeking a senior Data engineer that can think critically about how to best support and enable software development while maintaining high quality and predictability.
Join us, it will be fun!
What’s in it for you
Work with the latest and greatest technologies.
Learn from the best people. We constantly challenge the status quo, learn from each other, and invent new ways of building a great product.
We actually write automated tests. We take advantage of the latest automation tools like automatic deployments, CI/CD pipelines, and more.
Work remotely in the comfort of your home or a shared co-working space.
Work on challenging problems, innovate, and have fun while doing it.
Travel around the world. We offer occasional business trips to work with our clients face-to-face from their offices.

What are your typical clients?

What is the length of your engagements?

_data.title: Senior DevOps Engineer
_data.cta_header: Interested in being our TechOps engineer?

children.value: Overview

We're looking for a senior-level DevOps engineer to join our team. Headquartered in Los Angeles, California, Right Balance applies the latest technology and the best engineering practices to help businesses grow. We’re in the top 50 companies to watch in LA.
Project Details

Our client just raised a $50M series B round of funding and is looking to double the engineering team in the next 6 months. It’s your chance to join a high-quality engineering team with the hands-on CTO from SpaceX, MySpace, and Honest Company.

Text messaging adoption is growing rapidly. Now, an average person spends 23 hours a week texting. The product is a text messaging automation software platform allowing E-Commerce store owners to do most of their customer communication over text messaging as opposed to old-school calls and emails.
The React.js front end is powered by Python / Django backend API on top of a PostgreSQL database with Kafka processing high throughput text messages at the scale of 10s of millions messages per day.
Soon we’ll be adding NoSQL and Kubernetes into the mix. Join us, it’ll be a lot of fun!
What’s in it for you
1. Work with the latest and greatest technologies.
2. Learn from the best people. We constantly challenge the status quo, learn from each other, and invent new ways of building a great product.
3. We actually write automated tests. We take advantage of the latest automation tools like automatic deployments, CI/CD pipelines, and more.
4. Work remotely at the comfort of your home or a shared co-working space.
5. Work on challenging problems, innovate, have fun while doing it.
6. Travel around the world. We offer occasional business trips to work with our clients face to face from their offices.
Required Qualifications
1. 5+ years of professional full-time experience with AWS.
2. 2+ years of experience with Terraform.
3. Extensive experience implementing best practices in network security like VPC setup, security groups, bastion/jumpbox setup, VPN, inbound rules, ingress traffic management, etc.
4. Deep understanding and hands-on experience with best practices around secrets management using the tools like Hashicorp Vault, AWS Secrets Manager, managing signing certificates, etc.
5. Extensive experience creating well architected CI/CD pipelines for medium size organizations.
6. Ability to lead by example, understand client’s goals, create and implement solutions to achieve them in a team setting.
7. Experience working in a medium-size team, helping several feature development teams with infrastructure needs in a highly collaborative and proactive way.
8. Striving for automation is a must. The ideal candidate should be willing to automate themselves out of their job.
9. Upper-intermediate to fluent speaking and writing English.
10. Ability to think outside of the box and work on the same project long term with a high degree of care.
Nice to haves
1. A formal Computer Science degree.
2. Working experience in a proper Agile / Scrum team environment.
3. Deep understanding of container orchestration frameworks like Kubernetes.
4. Serverless experience.
5. Experience with cloud infrastructure migration.
6. Experience working with messaging queues like Kafka, RabbitMQ, SQS, SNS, etc.
7. Ability to train engineering teams on best DevOps practices.
8. Growth stage startup experience.
9. Technical leadership experience.
10. Team management experience.
11. Open source contributions, presentations, and publications.
Frequently Asked Questions
What are your typical clients?

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups at the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company already achieved a product-market fit and is looking to expand rapidly. That’s where we bring the best engineering practices, strong architecture, and the latest technologies to help companies scale.
What is the length of your projects?
Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years.
What’s your company size?
The Right Balance team is 10 - 15 people. The current client size team is 25 people looking to double it this year. It’s exciting to be a part of this growth making some meaningful contributions.
What happens if the engagement is completed?
Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current project is ramping down, we’ll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.
What are your core values?

We value autonomy, grind, empathy, mastery, and giving back to the community. We expect you to be autonomous, working directly with the client to build the best product. We value hard work, helping each other, constant learning as well as open-source contributions, and knowledge sharing.

_data.text:
## Overview

We're looking for a senior-level DevOps engineer to join our team. Headquartered in Los Angeles, California, Right Balance applies the latest technology and the best engineering practices to help businesses grow. We’re in the top 50 companies to watch in LA.

## Project Details

Our client just raised a $50M series B round of funding and is looking to double the engineering team in the next 6 months. It’s your chance to join a high-quality engineering team with the hands-on CTO from SpaceX, MySpace, and Honest Company.

Text messaging adoption is growing rapidly. Now, an average person spends 23 hours a week texting. The product is a text messaging automation software platform allowing E-Commerce store owners to do most of their customer communication over text messaging as opposed to old-school calls and emails.

The React.js front end is powered by Python / Django backend API on top of a PostgreSQL database with Kafka processing high throughput text messages at the scale of 10s of millions messages per day.

Soon we’ll be adding NoSQL and Kubernetes into the mix. Join us, it’ll be a lot of fun!

## What’s in it for you

1\. Work with the latest and greatest technologies.

2\. Learn from the best people. We constantly challenge the status quo, learn from each other, and invent new ways of building a great product.

3\. We actually write automated tests. We take advantage of the latest automation tools like automatic deployments, CI/CD pipelines, and more.

4\. Work remotely at the comfort of your home or a shared co-working space.

5\. Work on challenging problems, innovate, have fun while doing it.

6\. Travel around the world. We offer occasional business trips to work with our clients face to face from their offices.

## Required Qualifications

1\. 5+ years of professional full-time experience with AWS.

2\. 2+ years of experience with Terraform.

3\. Extensive experience implementing best practices in network security like VPC setup, security groups, bastion/jumpbox setup, VPN, inbound rules, ingress traffic management, etc.

4\. Deep understanding and hands-on experience with best practices around secrets management using the tools like Hashicorp Vault, AWS Secrets Manager, managing signing certificates, etc.

5\. Extensive experience creating well architected CI/CD pipelines for medium size organizations.

6\. Ability to lead by example, understand client’s goals, create and implement solutions to achieve them in a team setting.

7\. Experience working in a medium-size team, helping several feature development teams with infrastructure needs in a highly collaborative and proactive way.

8\. Striving for automation is a must. The ideal candidate should be willing to automate themselves out of their job.

9\. Upper-intermediate to fluent speaking and writing English.

10\. Ability to think outside of the box and work on the same project long term with a high degree of care.

## Nice to haves

1\. A formal Computer Science degree.

2\. Working experience in a proper Agile / Scrum team environment.

3\. Deep understanding of container orchestration frameworks like Kubernetes.

4\. Serverless experience.

5\. Experience with cloud infrastructure migration.

6\. Experience working with messaging queues like Kafka, RabbitMQ, SQS, SNS, etc.

7\. Ability to train engineering teams on best DevOps practices.

8\. Growth stage startup experience.

9\. Technical leadership experience.

10\. Team management experience.

11\. Open source contributions, presentations, and publications.

## Frequently Asked Questions

> _What are your typical clients?_

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups at the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company already achieved a product-market fit and is looking to expand rapidly. That’s where we bring the best engineering practices, strong architecture, and the latest technologies to help companies scale.

> _What is the length of your projects?_

Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years.

> _What’s your company size?_

The Right Balance team is 10 - 15 people. The current client size team is 25 people looking to double it this year. It’s exciting to be a part of this growth making some meaningful contributions.

> _What happens if the engagement is completed?_

Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current project is ramping down, we’ll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.

> _What are your core values?_

We value autonomy, grind, empathy, mastery, and giving back to the community. We expect you to be autonomous, working directly with the client to build the best product. We value hard work, helping each other, constant learning as well as open-source contributions, and knowledge sharing.

Role Overview

Software engineering is at the core of Right Balance and the Senior Engineering Manager role is key to the company’s overall performance. In this role, you’ll be focusing on the three main aspects: sales, hiring, and management. Working closely with our Account Executive, Account Manager, and VP of Operations you’ll identify the needs of different technology organizations and work with technology executives on making their vision a reality. Last but not least, you’ll be managing an international team of software engineers around the globe in multiple companies propelling their careers to the next level.
What’s in it for you
1. Work with top-level CTOs, VPs of Engineering, and Directors from US-based startups.
2. Career growth opportunities in a rapidly growing company.
3. Working directly with the VP of Operations as a part of the management team.
4. Work remotely at the comfort of your home or a shared co-working space.
5. Being able to help innovative companies make a positive impact globally.
Required Qualifications
1. 5+ years of full-time hands-on engineering management experience.
2. 3+ years of hands-on software engineering experience.
3. Experience working with a sales team.
4. Hands-on experience managing engineering teams, budgets, projects, headcount, and external vendors.
5. Advanced written and verbal level of English.
6. Ability to have 6 hours overlap with the US Pacific Time zone.
Nice to haves
1. Hands-on coder today (even if rusty).
2. Hands-on experience interviewing engineers including live coding and architecture.
3. Experience working with US-based startups.
4. Growth stage startup experience.
5. Industry publications and/or presentations.
6. Bachelor’s degree in business or related field.

_data.text:
## Company Overview

Headquartered in Los Angeles, California, Right Balance applies the latest technology and best engineering practices to help businesses grow. We’re in the top 50 companies to watch in LA.

## Role Overview

Software engineering is at the core of Right Balance and the Senior Engineering Manager role is key to the company’s overall performance. In this role, you’ll be focusing on the three main aspects: sales, hiring, and management. Working closely with our Account Executive, Account Manager, and VP of Operations you’ll identify the needs of different technology organizations and work with technology executives on making their vision a reality. Last but not least, you’ll be managing an international team of software engineers around the globe in multiple companies propelling their careers to the next level.

## What’s in it for you

1\. Work with top-level CTOs, VPs of Engineering, and Directors from US-based startups.

2\. Career growth opportunities in a rapidly growing company.

3\. Working directly with the VP of Operations as a part of the management team.

4\. Work remotely at the comfort of your home or a shared co-working space.

5\. Being able to help innovative companies make a positive impact globally.

## Required Qualifications

1\. 5+ years of full-time hands-on engineering management experience.

2\. 3+ years of hands-on software engineering experience.

3\. Experience working with a sales team.

4\. Hands-on experience managing engineering teams, budgets, projects, headcount, and external vendors.

5\. Advanced written and verbal level of English.

6\. Ability to have 6 hours overlap with the US Pacific Time zone.

## Nice to haves

1\. Hands-on coder today (even if rusty).

2\. Hands-on experience interviewing engineers including live coding and architecture.

3\. Experience working with US-based startups.

4\. Growth stage startup experience.

5\. Industry publications and/or presentations.

6\. Bachelor’s degree in business or related field.

## Frequently Asked Questions

>_What are your typical clients?_

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups at the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company already achieved a product-market fit and is looking to expand rapidly. That’s where we bring the best engineering practices, strong architecture, and the latest technologies to help companies scale. Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years.

>_What’s your company size?_

The Right Balance team is 60+ people going to 200 by the end of 2022.

>_What are your core values?_

Client First: we only win when our clients win. We treat client challenges as our own.

Ownership: we embrace responsibility, taking on challenges,getting them to completion, and enjoying getting things done.

Quality: we’re passionate about achieving qualityoutcomes by applying meticulous attention to detail.

_data.title: Senior Front End Developer
_data.cta_header: Interested in our Senior Front End Developer?

children.value: Overview

We're looking for a strong senior-level Front End Developer. Headquartered in Los Angeles, California, Right Balance applies the latest technology and the best engineering practices to help businesses grow. We’re in the top 50 companies to watch in LA.
Project Details

Our client is a global leader for app-driven in-store & campus technology that delivers digital media to screens and tablets for corporate TV, digital marketing boards, digital signage, and interactive kiosks using an intuitive content management console in the cloud. They enable retailers to maximize their floor space by using the power of the "endless aisle" where consumers are offered a broader assortment of products even in the smallest physical store environment. They improve the commerce experience by connecting brands, retailers, and consumers through beautiful smart software.

The retail landscape is undergoing major changes. Help us to build beautiful and elegant interactive experiences for brands and retailers to navigate these shifts in consumer behavior to weather the commerce evolution.

We are using the latest technologies like Serverless with AWS Lambda and NoSQL (MongoDB). Our serverless microservices written in Node.js transfer close to 5TB of data per month among all devices at scale. It’s a full-stack Javascript/Typescript opportunity since the front end is written in Angular. If you love technical challenges, and the fun of building great things, join us!
What’s in it for you
Work with the latest and greatest technologies.
Learn from the best people. We constantly challenge the status quo, learn from each other, and invent new ways of building a great product.
We actually write automated tests. We take advantage of the latest automation tools like automatic deployments, CI/CD pipelines, and more.
Flexible hours. Just join daily standups, sprint planning, and retrospective meetings. Other than that you’re in control of your own schedule.
Work remotely at the comfort of your home or a shared co-working space.
Work on challenging problems, innovate, have fun while doing it.
Travel around the world. We offer occasional business trips to work with our clients face to face from their offices.
Required Qualifications
5+ years of professional full-time hands-on front-end coding experience (any of Angular, React, Vue, jQuery, Bootsrap, etc).
3+ years of experience with Angular.
2+ years of experience with CSS.
Intermediate to fluent speaking and writing English.
Experience working with RESTful Web Services.
Expertise in Document Object Model and DOM Functions.
Extensive knowledge in developing applications in a single page (SPAs).
Experience writing unit tests and testing tools like Jasmine or Protractor.
Competence in version control and deployment systems like Git, Bitbucket, and Bitbucket pipeline.
Experience with Agile/Scrum methodology working in a team environment, actively participating in retrospectives to improve practices.
Experience working with back-end developers and UI/UX experts to ensure that the definition of done is fully satisfied.
Drive performance tuning, contribute on unit and integration testing.
Ability to embrace and institute best practices and coding standards within the team
Experience composing detailed design specifications.
Ability to contribute on 3D concepts, implementation and technologies along with fast prototyping.
Nice to haves
Ability to remain aware of evolving needs and opportunities, showing flexibility in doing whatever is appropriate to support the Company’s success.
Desire to pursue educational opportunities to maintain advanced and up-to-date knowledge in the field.
Willingness to perform all other related duties as required, assigned and understanding that the items in this description are not all-inclusive.
Ability to contribute on the WCAG 2.0 AA level.
Frequently Asked Questions
What are your typical clients?

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups at the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company already achieved a product-market fit and is looking to expand rapidly. That’s where we bring the best engineering practices, strong architecture, and the latest technologies to help companies scale.
What is the length of your projects?
Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years.
What’s your company size?

The Right Balance team is 30+ engineers looking to double by the end of the year. The current client size team is over 40 engineers with close to 200 total employees, looking to keep growing fast and aiming to hire up to 150 new employees over the next year. It’s your opportunity to be a part of this growth making meaningful contributions in a team of highly skilled professionals.
What happens if the engagement is completed?
Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current project is ramping down, we’ll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.
What are your core values?

We value autonomy, grind, empathy, mastery, and giving back to the community. We expect you to be autonomous, working directly with the client to build the best product. We value hard work, helping each other, constant learning as well as open-source contributions, and knowledge sharing.

_data.title: Senior Front-End Engineer

children.value: Overview

We're looking for a robust Senior Front-End Engineer to join our team. Headquartered in Los Angeles, California, Right Balance applies the latest technology and best engineering practices to help businesses grow. We’re in the top 50 companies to watch in LA.
Engagement Details

We are a USA-based company producing video solutions with the mission to advance scientific research and education. Our institutional clients comprise over 1,000 universities, colleges, and biopharma companies, including such leaders as Harvard, MIT, Yale, and Stanford. As a rapidly growing company, with offices in the USA, UK, Australia, and India servicing clients in over 60 countries, we are seeking talented individuals to join our company.

We are looking for an experienced Senior Front-End Engineer to help lead the development of fast, well-tested, and performant code for our web applications using React and supporting our legacy applications. If you are the kind of engineer passionate about developing well-built, reusable components following industry best practices, and love working in a collaborative environment with your product partners and dependency teams, then we want to talk to you. Join us, it will be fun!
What’s in it for you
Work with the latest and greatest technologies.
Learn from the best people. We constantly challenge the status quo, learn from each other, and invent new ways of building a great product.
We actually write automated tests. We take advantage of the latest automation tools like automatic deployments, CI/CD pipelines, and more.
Work remotely in the comfort of your home or a shared co-working space.
Work on challenging problems, innovate, and have fun while doing it.
Travel around the world. We offer occasional business trips to work with our clients face-to-face from their offices.
Required Qualifications
5+ years of experience working as a front-end engineer.
3+ years of experience with React.
1+ years of TypeScript experience.
Hands-on experience designing and developing scalable, high-performing,and fault-tolerant applications for large enterprises.
Demonstrated understanding and implementation of software design principles such as SOLID and DRY with Software as a Service (SaaS), and multi-tenancy application development.
Embraces the concepts of Agile Scrum software development and its related collaboration and issue-tracking tools (e.g., JIRA, Rally).
Experience working in a Continuous Integration / Continuous Delivery (CICD) model, including GitHub and CI pipeline automation tools.
Ability to triage and resolve incidents and lead incident investigations.
Nice to haves
CSS Experience.
Knowledge of PHP (Laravel, Symfony, etc.) is a plus.
Frequently Asked Questions
What are your typical clients?

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups in the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company has already achieved a product-market fit and is looking to expand rapidly. That’s where we bring the best engineering practices, strong architecture, and the latest technologies to help companies scale.
What is the length of your engagements?
Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years.
What’s your company size?

The Right Balance team has 40+ engineers going to 100+ by the end of the year. The current client team size is 25 engineers, expanding to 50 engineers by the end of this year. It’s exciting to be a part of this growth making some meaningful contributions.
What happens if the engagement is completed?
Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current engagement is ramping down, we’ll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.
What are your core values?
Client First: we only win when our clients win. We treat client challenges as our own.
Ownership: we embrace responsibility, taking on challenges, getting them to completion, and enjoying getting things done.
Quality: we’re passionate about achieving quality outcomes by applying meticulous attention to detail.

## **_Overview_**

We're looking for a robust Senior Front-End Engineer to join our team. Headquartered in Los Angeles, California, Right Balance applies the latest technology and best engineering practices to help businesses grow. We’re in the top 50 companies to watch in LA.

## **_Engagement Details_**

We are a USA-based company producing video solutions with the mission to advance scientific research and education. Our institutional clients comprise over 1,000 universities, colleges, and biopharma companies, including such leaders as Harvard, MIT, Yale, and Stanford. As a rapidly growing company, with offices in the USA, UK, Australia, and India servicing clients in over 60 countries, we are seeking talented individuals to join our company.

We are looking for an experienced Senior Front-End Engineer to help lead the development of fast, well-tested, and performant code for our web applications using React and supporting our legacy applications. If you are the kind of engineer passionate about developing well-built, reusable components following industry best practices, and love working in a collaborative environment with your product partners and dependency teams, then we want to talk to you. Join us, it will be fun!

## **_What’s in it for you_**

1. Work with the latest and greatest technologies.
2. Learn from the best people. We constantly challenge the status quo, learn from each other, and invent new ways of building a great product.
3. We actually write automated tests. We take advantage of the latest automation tools like automatic deployments, CI/CD pipelines, and more.
4. Work remotely in the comfort of your home or a shared co-working space.
5. Work on challenging problems, innovate, and have fun while doing it.
6. Travel around the world. We offer occasional business trips to work with our clients face-to-face from their offices.

## **_Required Qualifications_**

1. 5+ years of experience working as a front-end engineer.
2. 3+ years of experience with React.
3. 1+ years of TypeScript experience.
4. Hands-on experience designing and developing scalable, high-performing,and fault-tolerant
   applications for large enterprises.
5. Demonstrated understanding and implementation of software design principles such as SOLID and DRY with Software as a Service (SaaS), and multi-tenancy application development.
6. Embraces the concepts of Agile Scrum software development and its related collaboration and issue-tracking tools (e.g., JIRA, Rally).
7. Experience working in a Continuous Integration / Continuous Delivery (CICD) model, including GitHub and CI pipeline automation tools.
8. Ability to triage and resolve incidents and lead incident investigations.

## **_Nice to haves_**

1. CSS Experience.
2. Knowledge of PHP (Laravel, Symfony, etc.) is a plus.

## **_Frequently Asked Questions_**

**What are your typical clients?**

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups in the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company has already achieved a product-market fit and is looking to expand rapidly. That’s where we bring the best engineering practices, strong architecture, and the latest technologies to help companies scale.

**What is the length of your engagements?**

Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years.

**What’s your company size?**

The Right Balance team has 40+ engineers going to 100+ by the end of the year. The current client team size is 25 engineers, expanding to 50 engineers by the end of this year. It’s exciting to be a part of this growth making some meaningful contributions.

**What happens if the engagement is completed?**

Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current engagement is ramping down, we’ll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.

**What are your core values?**

* Client First: we only win when our clients win. We treat client challenges as our own. 
* Ownership: we embrace responsibility, taking on challenges, getting them to completion, and enjoying getting things done. 
* Quality: we’re passionate about achieving quality outcomes by applying meticulous attention to detail.

_data.title: Senior Frontend Engineer

children.value: Overview

We're looking for a Senior Frontend Engineer. Headquartered in Los Angeles, California, Right Balance applies the latest technology and best engineering practices to help businesses grow. We’re in the top 50 companies to watch in LA.
Engagement Details

We're a fast-growing, pioneering financial wellness start-up that invests heavily in the growth and development of its team members. As a financial education company, we provide a turn-key collaborative money mentorship solution that’s derived from the belief that our financial mentors are the last great hope for educating the working population on healthy money habits and positive behavior change. We seek to spread financial literacy by creating custom programs tailored to organizational needs that ease monetary stress and equip employees with how to plan for their future.
There are 3 different React apps. We need to detach from Create React App, introduce Typescript, add Next.js into the mix, and implement a consistent state management approach across the apps.

Support the development of our web and mobile applications. The ideal candidate will thrive in a dynamic environment, have a deep understanding of best practices for performance/stress/load testing, and have solid attention to detail. Our platform also leverages .NET, Azure DevOps, AWS, and Docker.
What’s in it for you
1. Learn and evolve your skills using the latest and greatest technology tools in a rapidly growing company
2. Learn from the best engineers. We constantly challenge the status quo and invent new ways of building a great product.
3. Flexible hours. Just join daily standups, sprint planning, and retrospective meetings. Other than that you’re in control of your own schedule
4. 100% remote. Work anywhere, whether it is remotely in the comfort of your home, in a shared co-working space, in an RV on the beach, or while being a nomad in another country.
5. Work on challenging problems, innovate, impacting lots of people's lives for the better while having fun doing it.
Required Qualifications
5+ years of hands-on full-time software engineering experience.
3+ years of hands-on full-time experience with React.js.
Advanced to fluent speaking and writing English. Able to have a real-time conversation.
Expert ability to break down complex and ambiguous requirements into actionable and technical deliverables.
Deep understanding of HTML/CSS, responsive design practices (SCSS/SASS, Minification, Webpack).
Experience creating and updating CRUD interfaces using Material UI (MUI) along with API integration.
Understanding of OOP/Flux design principles.
Knowledge of Next.js.
Experience using CI/CD: Git, Github, Azure DevOps.
Nice to haves
1. BS/MS degree in Computer Science or related field.
2. Experience with building apps using server-side rendering (Next.JS or similar).
3. Experience with Agile/Kanban methodologies and best practices.
4. Excellent communication skills and the ability to have fun in a small team environment.
Frequently Asked Questions
What are your typical clients?

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups at the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company already achieved a product-market fit and is looking to expand rapidly. That’s where we bring the best engineering practices, strong architecture, and the latest technologies to help companies scale.
What is the length of your engagements?
Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years so you are able to evolve your career with the company you are currently working in.
What’s your company size?

The Right Balance team is 60+ engineers going to 100 by the end of the year. The current client size team is 20+ people. The timing is great to be a part of a rapidly growing team making meaningful contributions.
What happens if the engagement is completed?
Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current engagement is ramping down, we’ll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.
What are your core values?
Client First: we only win when our clients win. We treat client challenges as our own.
Ownership: we embrace responsibility, taking on challenges, getting them to completion, and enjoying getting things done.
Quality: we’re passionate about achieving quality outcomes by applying meticulous attention to detail.

## Overview

We're looking for a Senior Frontend Engineer. Headquartered in Los Angeles, California, Right Balance applies the latest technology and best engineering practices to help businesses grow. We’re in the top 50 companies to watch in LA.

## Engagement Details

We're a fast-growing, pioneering financial wellness start-up that invests heavily in the growth and development of its team members. As a financial education company, we provide a turn-key collaborative money mentorship solution that’s derived from the belief that our financial mentors are the last great hope for educating the working population on healthy money habits and positive behavior change. We seek to spread financial literacy by creating custom programs tailored to organizational needs that ease monetary stress and equip employees with how to plan for their future. 

There are 3 different React apps. We need to detach from Create React App, introduce Typescript, add Next.js into the mix, and implement a consistent state management approach across the apps.

Support the development of our web and mobile applications. The ideal candidate will thrive in a dynamic environment, have a deep understanding of best practices for performance/stress/load testing, and have solid attention to detail. Our platform also leverages .NET, Azure DevOps, AWS, and Docker.

## What’s in it for you

1\. Learn and evolve your skills using the latest and greatest technology tools in a rapidly growing company

2\. Learn from the best engineers. We constantly challenge the status quo and invent new ways of building a great product.

3\. Flexible hours. Just join daily standups, sprint planning, and retrospective meetings. Other than that you’re in control of your own schedule

4\. 100% remote. Work anywhere, whether it is remotely in the comfort of your home, in a shared co-working space, in an RV on the beach, or while being a nomad in another country.

5\. Work on challenging problems, innovate, impacting lots of people's lives for the better while having fun doing it.

## Required Qualifications

- 5+ years of hands-on full-time software engineering experience.

- 3+ years of hands-on full-time experience with React.js.

- Advanced to fluent speaking and writing English. Able to have a real-time conversation.

- Expert ability to break down complex and ambiguous requirements into actionable and technical deliverables.

- Deep understanding of HTML/CSS, responsive design practices (SCSS/SASS, Minification, Webpack).

- Experience creating and updating CRUD interfaces using Material UI (MUI) along with API integration.

- Understanding of OOP/Flux design principles.

- Knowledge of Next.js.

- Experience using CI/CD: Git, Github, Azure DevOps.

## Nice to haves

1\. BS/MS degree in Computer Science or related field.

2\. Experience with building apps using server-side rendering (Next.JS or similar).

3\. Experience with Agile/Kanban methodologies and best practices.

4\. Excellent communication skills and the ability to have fun in a small team environment.


## Frequently Asked Questions

>_What are your typical clients?_

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups at the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company already achieved a product-market fit and is looking to expand rapidly. That’s where we bring the best engineering practices, strong architecture, and the latest technologies to help companies scale.

>_What is the length of your engagements?_

Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years so you are able to evolve your career with the company you are currently working in.

>_What’s your company size?_

The Right Balance team is 60+ engineers going to 100 by the end of the year. The current client size team is 20+ people. The timing is great to be a part of a rapidly growing team making meaningful contributions.

>_What happens if the engagement is completed?_

Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current engagement is ramping down, we’ll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.

>_What are your core values?_

Client First: we only win when our clients win. We treat client challenges as our own.

Ownership: we embrace responsibility, taking on challenges, getting them to completion, and enjoying getting things done.

Quality: we’re passionate about achieving quality outcomes by applying meticulous attention to detail.

_data.title: Senior Full Stack Engineer

children.value: Overview

We're looking for a Fullstack Engineer to join our team. Headquartered in Los Angeles, California, Right Balance applies the latest technology and the best engineering practices to help businesses grow. We’re in the top 50 companies to watch in LA.
Project Details
Our client is a leading software solutions provider in the online advertising market. The platform streamlines the ad sales processes for some of the most prominent publishers on the Web.

We’re committed to continuous innovation by using the latest technologies in the cloud arena. We’re moving to microservices, optimizing the flow of data in the AdTech stack to connect publishers and advertisers in a meaningful way.

You'll be working with a large scale system involving a lot of features, working with terabytes of data in our database. Performance is important for our team, as well as scalability. Constantly challenging the status quo, we're always improving our processes. Your voice will be heard.
You'll make an impact on the team by utilizing your technological experience.

Our stack is .NET on the backend, moving to .NET Core with SQL Server deployed to Azure Cloud. On the frontend, we’re using Vue.js. Our release pipeline is streamlined with CI/CD running on Azure pipelines. For our infrastructure, we believe in managing it as code, currently using Terraform to do so. Some of our services use Azure functions, as well as running in containers on Kubernetes. Having a lot of fun doing it, join us!
What’s in it for you
1. Work with the latest and greatest technologies.
2. Learn from the best people. We constantly challenge the status quo, learn from each other, and invent new ways of building a great product.
3. We actually write automated tests. We take advantage of the latest automation tools like automatic deployments, CI/CD pipelines, and more.
4. Work remotely at the comfort of your home or a shared co-working space.
5. Work on challenging problems, innovate, have fun while doing it.
6. Travel around the world. We offer occasional business trips to work with our clients face to face from their offices.
Required Qualifications
1. 5+ years of professional full-time coding experience.
2. 3+ years of experience with .NET (or Java / Spring).
3. 1+ year of frontend experience with Vue.js (preferred), or similar like React, or Angular.
4. 2+ years of SQL experience.
5. Upper-intermediate to fluent speaking and writing English.
6. Solid understanding of Object Oriented Programming.
7. Deep knowledge of design patterns.
8. Azure cloud familiarity.
9. Generics experience.
10. Stored procedure familiarity and having an opinion on it.
Nice to haves
1. A formal Computer Science or equivalent degree.
2. Team management experience.
3. Tech leadership experience.
4. Professional Azure experience.
5. Experience with XML.
6. Telerik experience.
7. Web services experience, specifically WCF.
Frequently Asked Questions
What are your typical clients?

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups at the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company already achieved a product-market fit and is looking to expand rapidly. That’s where we bring the best engineering practices, strong architecture, and the latest technologies to help companies scale.
What is the length of your projects?
Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years.
What’s your company size?

The Right Balance team is 10 - 15 engineers. The current client team size is 30 engineers expanding to 50 engineers by the end of this year . It’s exciting to be a part of this growth making some meaningful contributions.
What happens if the engagement is completed?
Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current project is ramping down, we’ll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.
What are your core values?

We value autonomy, grind, empathy, mastery, and giving back to the community. We expect you to be autonomous, working directly with the client to build the best product. We value hard work, helping each other, constant learning as well as open-source contributions, and knowledge sharing.

You'll be working with a large scale system involving a lot of features, working with terabytes of data in our database. Performance is important for our team, as well as scalability. Constantly challenging the status quo, we're always improving our processes. Your voice will be heard.

You'll make an impact on the team by utilizing your technological experience.

Our stack is .NET on the backend, moving to .NET Core with SQL Server deployed to Azure Cloud. On the frontend, we’re using Vue.js. Our release pipeline is streamlined with CI/CD running on Azure pipelines. For our infrastructure, we believe in managing it as code, currently using Terraform to do so. Some of our services use Azure functions, as well as running in containers on Kubernetes. Having a lot of fun doing it, join us!

## What’s in it for you

1\. Work with the latest and greatest technologies.

2\. Learn from the best people. We constantly challenge the status quo, learn from each other, and invent new ways of building a great product.

3\. We actually write automated tests. We take advantage of the latest automation tools like automatic deployments, CI/CD pipelines, and more.

4\. Work remotely at the comfort of your home or a shared co-working space.

5\. Work on challenging problems, innovate, have fun while doing it.

6\. Travel around the world. We offer occasional business trips to work with our clients face to face from their offices.

## Required Qualifications

1\. 5+ years of professional full-time coding experience.

2\. 3+ years of experience with .NET (or Java / Spring).

3\. 1+ year of frontend experience with Vue.js (preferred), or similar like React, or Angular.

4\. 2+ years of SQL experience.

5\. Upper-intermediate to fluent speaking and writing English.

6\. Solid understanding of Object Oriented Programming.

7\. Deep knowledge of design patterns.

8\. Azure cloud familiarity.

9\. Generics experience.

10\. Stored procedure familiarity and having an opinion on it.

## Nice to haves

1\. A formal Computer Science or equivalent degree.

2\. Team management experience.

3\. Tech leadership experience.

4\. Professional Azure experience.

5\. Experience with XML.

6\. Telerik experience.

7\. Web services experience, specifically WCF.

## Frequently Asked Questions

>_What are your typical clients?_

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups at the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company already achieved a product-market fit and is looking to expand rapidly. That’s where we bring the best engineering practices, strong architecture, and the latest technologies to help companies scale.

>_What is the length of your projects?_

Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years.

>_What’s your company size?_

The Right Balance team is 10 - 15 engineers. The current client team size is 30 engineers expanding to 50 engineers by the end of this year . It’s exciting to be a part of this growth making some meaningful contributions.

>_What happens if the engagement is completed?_

Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current project is ramping down, we’ll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.

>_What are your core values?_

We value autonomy, grind, empathy, mastery, and giving back to the community. We expect you to be autonomous, working directly with the client to build the best product. We value hard work, helping each other, constant learning as well as open-source contributions, and knowledge sharing.

# Overview

We're looking for a strong senior-level Node.js software engineer. Headquartered in Los Angeles, California, Right Balance applies the latest technology and the best engineering practices to help businesses grow. We’re in the top 50 companies to watch in LA.

# Project Details

Billions of dollars and countless wasted hours are spent on coin and prepaid card-driven systems, an unsatisfying 70 year-old technology ripe for digital transformation. Our client is bringing laundry day into the 21st century using machines that leverage innovative technology like IoT, digital interfaces, machine learning, and other patent-pending solutions to provide PMs peace-of-mind and giving residents a modern laundry experience.

In this role you’ll be working with internal and client-facing apps for the modern laundry experience. Most of the development will be using Express with NoSQL and Vue.

You’ll be a part of a small team led by a seasoned hands on CTO with over 20 years of experience making meaningful contributions to the codebase.

# What’s in it for you

1. Work with the latest and greatest technologies.
2. Learn from the best people. We constantly challenge the status quo, learn from each other, and invent new ways of building a great product.
3. We actually write automated tests. We take advantage of the latest automation tools like automatic deployments, CI/CD pipelines, and more.
4. Flexible hours. Just join daily standups, sprint planning, and retrospective meetings. Other than that you’re in control of your own schedule.
5. Work remotely at the comfort of your home or a shared co-working space.
6. Work on challenging problems, innovate, have fun while doing it.
7. Travel around the world. We offer occasional business trips to work with our clients face to face from their offices.

# Required Qualifications

 1. 5+ years of hands-on full-time coding experience.
 2. 3+ years of Node.js / Serverless on the back-end
 3. 1+ years of cloud experience with AWS
 4. 1+ years of experience with NoSQL
 5. Advanced verbal and written English.
 6. Some familiarity or desire to learn TypeScript
 7. Superior analytical skills with a good problem-solving attitude
 8. Experience writing unit tests to identify malfunctions.
 9. Strong oral and written communication skills
10. Engineering expertise and tenacity to support the entire application lifecycle (concept, design, test, release and support).
11. Experience integrating back-end API services.
12. Strong performance, quality, and responsiveness of the application.
13. Ability to provide troubleshooting as necessary in testing, QA and Production environments.
14. Ability to Identify applications bottlenecks and opportunities to optimize performance.
15. Help maintain code quality, organization, and automatization.

# Nice to haves

1. 1+ years of Experience with SPA (Vue preferred)
2. Working experience in a proper Agile / Scrum team environment.
3. Understanding how to properly use TypeScript, VueJs, Vue CLI, Vue Router, Vuex, and Vue DevTools to maximize code reusability, easily expand application functionality, and standardize UI style.
4. Experience with online payment processors (Stripe)
5. Experience implementing UI tests.
6. Deep understanding of automated testing, ability to set up automated testing frameworks, testing architecture, data seeding, mocking, and implementing best testing practices.
7. Growth stage startup experience.
8. Technical leadership experience.
9. Team management experience.

# Frequently Asked Questions

_What are your typical clients?_

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups at the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company already achieved a product-market fit and is looking to expand rapidly. That’s where we bring the best engineering practices, strong architecture, and the latest technologies to help companies scale.

_What is the length of your engagements?_

Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years.

_What’s your company size?_

The Right Balance team is 50+ engineers going to 100+ by the end of the year. The current client size team is 15+ people. This is an opportunity to build some foundational IoT technology in a small team of seasoned professionals.

_What happens if the engagement is completed?_

Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current project is ramping down, we’ll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.

_What are your core values?_

We value autonomy, grind, empathy, mastery, and giving back to the community. We expect you to be autonomous, working directly with the client to build the best product. We value hard work, helping each other, constant learning as well as open-source contributions, and knowledge sharing.

We're looking for a Senior Fullstack Engineer. Headquartered in Los Angeles, California, Right Balance applies the latest technology and best engineering practices to help businesses grow. We’re in the top 50 companies to watch in LA.
Engagement Details

Our client is a fast-paced, high-growth startup, committed to transforming a $30-billion industry through our all-in-one platform. Leveraging the latest technology, we’re taking commercial contractors from the world of pen and paper operations to digitized, efficient, data-driven business.

The co-founders have over a decade of experience in both construction and SaaS technology, as well as a resume that includes Stanford, Harvard, Wharton, Cornell, Microsoft, and multiple successful startup exits, including a $1.2 billion acquisition.
Our client has raised multiple rounds of funding from some of the largest and most reputable Venture Capital firms, including Founders Fund, Fika Ventures, and Greenspring Associates.

Our engineering team is distributed across Los Angeles, Toronto, and Latin America. As a pioneering member of the team, your primary focus will be to help continue to build the product from the ground up. We are looking for a motivated, self-starter who can work in a distributed team environment. This is a hands-on role. The day-to-day responsibilities are broad, and you will ultimately be responsible for shipping software

Our frontend is in React.js, the backend is in Node.js, so get your Javascript on! Solve interesting challenges in a rapid growth environment. We have greenfield development of new product modules using the latest tools and frameworks.
Come join us, it’ll be fun!
What’s in it for you
1. Learn and evolve your skills using the latest and greatest technology tools in a rapidly growing company
2. Learn from the best engineers. We constantly challenge the status quo and invent new ways of building a great product.
3. Flexible hours. Just join daily standups, sprint planning, and retrospective meetings. Other than that you’re in control of your own schedule
4. 100% remote. Work anywhere, whether it is remotely in the comfort of your home, in a shared co-working space, in an RV on the beach, or while being a nomad in another country.
5. Work on challenging problems, innovate, impacting lots of people's lives for the better while having fun doing it.
Required Qualifications
1. 7+ years of full-time hands-on Software Engineering experience.
2. Upper-intermediate to fluent speaking and writing English. Able to have a real-time conversation.
3. 5+ years of work experience with Node.js backend.
4. 3+ years of full-time hands-on experience with React.js.
5. Unit testing experience.
6. Experience working in startups.
7. Strong proactive communication skills.
8. Ability to accomplish great things without much guidence or supervision.
Nice to haves
1. Java/Spring experience.
2. Code complexity, Big O notation.
3. Can collaborate in a cross-functional team with engineers, non-technical stakeholders, and early customers.
4. Excellent verbal & written communication skills.
Frequently Asked Questions
What are your typical clients?

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups in the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company already achieved a product-market fit and is looking to expand rapidly. That’s where we bring the best engineering practices, strong architecture, and the latest technologies to help companies scale.
What is the length of your engagements?
Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years so you are able to evolve your career with the company you are currently working in.
What’s your company size?

The Right Balance team is 60+ engineers going to 200 by the end of the year. The current client size team is 150+ people. The timing is great to be a part of a rapidly growing team making meaningful contributions.
What happens if the engagement is completed?
Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current engagement is ramping down, we’ll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.
What are your core values?
Client First: we only win when our clients win. We treat client challenges as our own.
Ownership: we embrace responsibility, taking on challenges, getting them to completion, and enjoying getting things done.
Quality: we’re passionate about achieving quality outcomes by applying meticulous attention to detail.

## Overview
We're looking for a strong senior-level Full Stack Engineer. Headquartered in Los Angeles, California,
Right Balance applies the latest technology and the best engineering practices to help businesses grow.
We’re in the top 50 companies to watch in LA.

## Project Details
Our client is a post Series D company at a $900M valuation that has raised more than $400M in funding across equity and debt.
A Fintech that is revolutionizing lending in under-served verticals that account for tens of billions of dollars
in annual transactions. Its mission is to connect people with their passions by simplifying the transaction process
to purchase powersports vehicles such as motorcycles, ATVs, mowers, snowmobiles, scooters and more.
Working with 40 OEM brands, more than 3,500 merchants in the USA and reaching millions of enthusiasts through
the largest powersports media brands in the world, is helping consumers to buy their favorite products with instant,
frictionless financing. Being profitable and having the privilege of raising capital at terms they define,
which is rare for tech startups all across the board and even rarer for a company that’s only 7 years old,
they are on track to IPO in the next few years and moving into other verticals, such as marine/boats/RVs.

Our CTO comes from well known tech companies like Amazon and **Microsoft** bringing 25+ years of industry experience
to the table. You’ll be a part of a strong engineering culture building **modular software** using the latest technologies
like **React**, **Django**, PostgreSQL, and Docker running on AWS cloud. We believe in **automation** and strong architecture.
With us, you’ll be building robust **microservices** on the backend, single source of truth **data lake**, as well as modern
componentized front end experience. Join us, it won’t be boring. We’re building new products on a path towards **$1.5B
in loan originations this year**.

## What’s in it for you
1. Work with the latest and greatest technologies.
2. Learn from the best people. We constantly challenge the status quo, learn from each other, and invent new ways of building a great product.
3. We actually write automated tests. We take advantage of the latest automation tools like automatic deployments, CI/CD pipelines, and more.
4. Flexible hours. Just join daily standups, sprint planning, and retrospective meetings. Other than that you’re in control of your own schedule.
5. Work remotely at the comfort of your home or a shared co-working space.
6. Work on challenging problems, innovate, have fun while doing it.
7. Travel around the world. We offer occasional business trips to work with our clients face to face from their offices.

## Required Qualifications
1. 5+ years of full-time hands-on experience with at least one high-level general-purpose language such as Python, Javascript, Java, C#, Ruby, PHP, Go, etc.
2. 3+ years of full-time hands-on experience on the front end.
3. 3+ years of full-time hands-on experience on the backend.
4. Upper-intermediate to fluent speaking and writing English.
5. Unit testing experience.
6. Experience designing and implementing technical solutions.
7. Experience working in a collaborative team environment.
8. Solutions oriented attitude with a willingness to take **ownership**.
9. Proven **proactive** communication and collaboration skills.
10. Experience and desire for mentoring junior engineers.

## Nice to haves
1. Experience working with React, Node, Django, PostgreSQL, and Docker.
2. Runtime and memory complexity using Big O notation.
3. A formal Computer Science degree.
4. Working experience in a proper Agile / Scrum team environment.
5. Deep understanding of automated testing, ability to set up automated testing frameworks, testing architecture, data seeding, mocking, and implementing best testing practices.
6. Growth stage startup experience.
7. Technical leadership experience.
8. Team management experience.
9. Open source contributions, presentations, and publications.

## Frequently Asked Questions

> What are your typical clients?

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups at the growth stage.
Usually, at this stage, the company already achieved a product-market fit and is looking to expand rapidly.
That’s where we bring the best engineering practices, strong architecture, and the latest technologies to help companies scale.

> What is the length of your projects?

Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years.

> What’s your company size?

The Right Balance team is 30+ engineers looking to double by the end of the year.
The current client size team is over 40 engineers with close to 200 total employees,
looking to keep growing fast and aiming to hire up to 150 new employees over the next year.
It’s your opportunity to be a part of this growth making meaningful contributions  in a team of highly skilled professionals.

> What happens if the engagement is completed?

Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current project is ramping down,
we’ll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.

> What are your core values?

We value autonomy, grind, empathy, mastery, and giving back to the community. We expect you to be autonomous,
working directly with the client to build the best product. We value hard work, helping each other, constant learning
as well as open-source contributions, and knowledge sharing.

Our client just raised a $50M series B round of funding and is looking to double the engineering team in the next 6 months. It’s your chance to join a high-quality engineering team with the hands-on CTO from SpaceX, MySpace, and Honest Company.

Text messaging adoption is growing rapidly. Now, an average person spends 23 hours a week texting. The product is a text messaging automation software platform allowing E-Commerce store owners to do most of their customer communication over text messaging as opposed to old-school calls and emails.

The technology stack is React.js on the front end with Redux Saga, Storybooks, slick-looking UI with a custom design system, and an AI-powered conversation builder using the Canvas API.

The back-end is powered by Python / Django on top of a PostgreSQL database with Kafka processing high throughput text messages at the scale of 10s of millions of messages per day. Soon we’ll be adding NoSQL and Kubernetes into the mix. Join us, it’ll be a lot of fun!

 5. Ability to lead by example, understand client’s goals, create and implement solutions to achieve them in a team setting.

3. Deep understanding of automated testing, ability to set up automated testing 

   frameworks, testing architecture, data seeding, mocking, and implementing best testing practices.

We're looking for a Full-Stack. Headquartered in Los Angeles, California, Right Balance applies the latest technology and best engineering practices to help businesses grow. We’re in the top 50 companies to watch in LA.
Project Details

Our company has a newly created opportunity for an exceptional Senior Full-Stack to join our energetic, growing team! We are a world-class start-up that provides access to a shared closet where members can borrow designer handbags, jewelry, and diamonds. We are a venture-backed, high-growth business that offers a competitive flexible environment that invests in its professionals. The engineer working on this project will start working on a new front-end project allowing them to make decisions on the future of the project.
Join us, it will be fun!
What’s in it for you
Learn and evolve your skills using the latest and greatest technology tools in a rapidly growing company.
Learn from the best engineers. We constantly challenge the status quo and invent new ways of building a great product.
Flexible hours. Just join daily standups, sprint planning, and retrospective meetings. Other than that you’re in control of your own schedule.
100% remote. Work anywhere, whether it is remotely in the comfort of your home, in a shared co-working space, in an RV on the beach, or while being a nomad in another country.
Work on challenging problems, innovate, impacting lots of people's lives for the better while having fun doing it.
Required Qualifications
5+ years of experience working full-time as a Software Engineer.
2+ years of experience with React.
2+ years of experience working with a Node.js back-end tool (Express, Sails, etc).
Advance English Level
Experience working with Typescript
Nice to haves
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related technical discipline (or equivalent experience).
Next.js. Experience.
Experience with subscription services.
E-commerce experience.
Experience with Contentful or other headless CMS.
Frequently Asked Questions
What are your typical clients?

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups in the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company already achieved a product-market fit and is looking to expand rapidly. That’s where we bring the best engineering practices, strong architecture, and the latest technologies to help companies scale.
What is the length of your engagements?
Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years so you are able to grow your career with the company you are currently working in.
What’s your company size?
The Right Balance team has 60+ engineers going to 100+ by the end of the year. It’s exciting to be a part of a solid engineering team making meaningful contributions.
What happens if the engagement is completed?
Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current engagement is ramping down, we’ll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.
What are your core values?
Client First: we only win when our clients win. We treat client challenges as our own.
Ownership: we embrace responsibility, taking on challenges, getting them to completion, and enjoying getting things done.
Quality: we’re passionate about achieving quality outcomes by applying meticulous attention to detail.

Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current engagement is ramping down, we’ll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.

They enable retailers to maximize their floor space by using the power of the "endless aisle" where consumers are offered a broader assortment of products even in the smallest physical store environment. They improve the commerce experience by connecting brands, retailers, and consumers through beautiful smart software.

The retail landscape is undergoing major changes. Help us to build beautiful and elegant interactive experiences for brands and retailers to navigate these shifts in consumer behavior to weather the commerce evolution.

We are using the latest technologies like Serverless with AWS Lambda and NoSQL (MongoDB). Our serverless microservices written in Node.js transfer close to 5TB of data per month among all devices at scale. It’s a full-stack Javascript/Typescript opportunity since the front end is written in Angular. If you love technical challenges, and the fun of building great things, join us!
What’s in it for you
Work with the latest and greatest technologies.
Learn from the best people. We constantly challenge the status quo, learn from each other, and invent new ways of building a great product.
We actually write automated tests. We take advantage of the latest automation tools like automatic deployments, CI/CD pipelines, and more.
Flexible hours. Just join daily standups, sprint planning, and retrospective meetings. Other than that you’re in control of your own schedule.
Work remotely at the comfort of your home or a shared co-working space.
Work on challenging problems, innovate, have fun while doing it.
Travel around the world. We offer occasional business trips to work with our client's face to face from their offices.
Required Qualifications
5+ years of full-time hands-on experience in JavaScript.
3+ years of Node.js experience.
3+ years of NoSQL (MongoDB, DynamoDB, or similar) experience.
2+ years of full-time hands-on experience with AWS Lambda.
Intermediate to fluent speaking and writing English.
Experience with data modeling and patterns using NoSQL database technology.
Experience developing Cloud applications with API management and distributed microservices-based architecture.
Ability to challenge and improve the underlying technology stack.
Must be comfortable around both front & back end technologies, development frameworks, 3rd party libraries, QA, and everything else that's required for the team to succeed.
Experience with or capability and desire to operate in Agile/Scrum methodology.
Ability to contribute to research technologies and fast prototyping
Ability to compose detailed design specifications.
Willingness to actively participate in root cause analysis and design sessions.
Nice to haves
Willingness to perform all other related duties as required, assigned and understanding that the items in this description are not all inclusive.
Experience in or burning desire to try TypeScript.
Ability to drive performance tuning, automation, monitoring and testability.
AWS or similar cloud certification..
Experience with Web application development using Angular.
Good knowledge of Docker and deployment life cycle.
Ability to create and drive better metrics, monitoring initiatives to gain valuable insights from the cloud services.
Ability to troubleshoot all build and deployment issues.
Ability to work remotely across time zones .
Frequently Asked Questions
What are your typical clients?

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups at the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company already achieved a product-market fit and is looking to expand rapidly. Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years.

What happens if the engagement is completed?
Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current project is ramping down, we’ll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.
What are your core values?

We value autonomy, grind, empathy, mastery, and giving back to the community. We expect you to be autonomous, working directly with the client to build the best product. We value hard work, helping each other, constant learning as well as open-source contributions, and knowledge sharing.
