They enable retailers to maximize their floor space by using the power of the "endless aisle" where consumers are offered a broader assortment of products even in the smallest physical store environment. They improve the commerce experience by connecting brands, retailers, and consumers through beautiful smart software.

The retail landscape is undergoing major changes. Help us to build beautiful and elegant interactive experiences for brands and retailers to navigate these shifts in consumer behavior to weather the commerce evolution.

You’ll work with several teams including business development, data, and product to solve challenging problems using software development and automation. Our team culture is a unique combination of structured vision and process maturity. In this role, you will be developing innovative cloud solutions based on Serverless using NoSQL DB solutions for transmitting around 5TB of data per month between all Kiosk devices, support current integrations, including deploying integration components in development/production environments. Our frontend uses the latest version of Angular. Our backend microservices are written in Typescript using Node.js, running on AWS Lambda.
What’s in it for you
Learn and evolve your skills using the latest and greatest technology tools in a rapidly growing company.
Learn from the best engineers. We constantly challenge the status quo and invent new ways of building a great product.
Flexible hours. Just join daily standups, sprint planning, and retrospective meetings. Other than that you’re in control of your own schedule.
100% remote. Work anywhere, whether it is remotely in the comfort of your home, in a shared co-working space, in an RV on the beach, or while being a nomad in another country.
Work on challenging problems, innovate, impacting lots of people's lives for the better while having fun doing it.
Required Qualifications
7+ years of full-time hands-on software engineering experience.
5+ years of full-time hands-in Node.js experience.
2+ years of working with AWS Lambda.
3+ years of MongoDB experience.
Upper-intermediate to fluent speaking and writing English. Able to have a technical real-time conversation.
Strong knowledge of JavaScript, ES6+.
Experience of developing Cloud applications with API management and distributed microservices based architecture.
Experience with data modeling and patterns using NoSQL database like MongoDB.
Must be comfortable around both front & back end technologies, development frameworks and 3rd party libraries.
Ability to challenge and improve the underlying technology stack.
Nice to haves
Willingness to perform all other related duties as required, assigned and understanding that the items in this description are not all inclusive.
Experience or burning desire to try TypeScript
Ability to drive performance tuning, automation, monitoring and testability.

Ability to reason through problems to reach solutions, troubleshooting ability, effective written and verbal communication skills and ability to see, type, speak on phone and work with various departments within the company.
Serverless / AWS Lambda
Experience with Web application development using Angular
Good knowledge of Docker and deployment life cycle
Ability to create and drive better metrics, monitoring initiatives to gain valuable insights from the cloud services
Ability to troubleshoot all build and deployment issues
Frequently Asked Questions
What are your typical clients?

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups in the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company already achieved a product-market fit and is looking to expand rapidly. That’s where we bring the best engineering practices, strong architecture, and the latest technologies to help companies scale.
What is the length of your engagements?
Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years so you are able to grow your career with the company you are currently working in.
What’s your company size?

The Right Balance team is 60+ engineers going to 200+ by the end of 2023. The current client size team is 50 people. It’s exciting to be a part of the solid engineering team making meaningful contributions.
What happens if the engagement is completed?
Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current engagement is ramping down, we’ll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.
What are your core values?
Client First: we only win when our clients win. We treat client challenges as our own.
Ownership: we embrace responsibility, taking on challenges, getting them to completion, and enjoying getting things done.
Quality: we’re passionate about achieving quality outcomes by applying meticulous attention to detail.

## **_Overview_**

We're looking for a strong Senior Full Stack engineer. Headquartered in Los Angeles, California, Right Balance applies the latest technology and best engineering practices to help businesses grow. We’re in the top 50 companies to watch in LA.

## **_Project Details_**

Our client is a global leader for app-driven in-store & campus technology that delivers digital media to screens and tablets for corporate TV, digital marketing boards, digital signage and interactive kiosks using an intuitive content management console in the cloud. They enable retailers to maximize their floor space by using the power of the "endless aisle" where consumers are offered a broader assortment of products even in the smallest physical store environment. They improve the commerce experience by connecting brands, retailers, and consumers through beautiful smart software.

The retail landscape is undergoing major changes. Help us to build beautiful and elegant interactive experiences for brands and retailers to navigate these shifts in consumer behavior to weather the commerce evolution.

You’ll work with several teams including business development, data, and product to solve challenging problems using software development and automation. Our team culture is a unique combination of structured vision and process maturity. In this role, you will be developing innovative cloud solutions based on Serverless using NoSQL DB solutions for transmitting around 5TB of data per month between all Kiosk devices, support current integrations, including deploying integration components in development/production environments. Our frontend uses the latest version of Angular. Our backend microservices are written in Typescript using Node.js, running on AWS Lambda.

## **_What’s in it for you_**

1. Learn and evolve your skills using the latest and greatest technology tools in a rapidly growing company.
2. Learn from the best engineers. We constantly challenge the status quo and invent new ways of building a great product.
3. Flexible hours. Just join daily standups, sprint planning, and retrospective meetings. Other than that you’re in control of your own schedule.
4. 100% remote. Work anywhere, whether it is remotely in the comfort of your home, in a shared co-working space, in an RV on the beach, or while being a nomad in another country.
5. Work on challenging problems, innovate, impacting lots of people's lives for the better while having fun doing it.

## **_Required Qualifications_**

1. 7+ years of full-time hands-on software engineering experience.
2. 5+ years of full-time hands-in Node.js experience.
3. 2+ years of working with AWS Lambda.
4. 3+ years of MongoDB experience.
5. Upper-intermediate to fluent speaking and writing English. Able to have a technical real-time conversation.
6. Strong knowledge of JavaScript, ES6+.
7. Experience of developing Cloud applications with API management and distributed microservices based architecture.
8. Experience with data modeling and patterns using NoSQL database like MongoDB.
9. Must be comfortable around both front & back end technologies, development frameworks and 3rd party libraries.
10. Ability to challenge and improve the underlying technology stack.

## **_Nice to haves_**

1. Willingness to perform all other related duties as required, assigned and understanding that the items in this description are not all inclusive.
2. Experience or burning desire to try TypeScript
3. Ability to drive performance tuning, automation, monitoring and testability.
4. Ability to reason through problems to reach solutions, troubleshooting ability, effective written and verbal communication skills and ability to see, type, speak on phone and work with various departments within the company.
5. Serverless / AWS Lambda
6. Experience with Web application development using Angular
7. Good knowledge of Docker and deployment life cycle
8. Ability to create and drive better metrics, monitoring initiatives to gain valuable insights from the cloud services
9. Ability to troubleshoot all build and deployment issues

## **_Frequently Asked Questions_**

> **_What are your typical clients?_**

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups in the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company already achieved a product-market fit and is looking to expand rapidly. That’s where we bring the best engineering practices, strong architecture, and the latest technologies to help companies scale.

> **_What is the length of your engagements?_**

Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years so you are able to grow your career with the company you are currently working in.

> **_What’s your company size?_**

The Right Balance team is 60+ engineers going to 200+ by the end of 2023. The current client size team is 50 people. It’s exciting to be a part of the solid engineering team making meaningful contributions.

> **_What happens if the engagement is completed?_**

Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current engagement is ramping down, we’ll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.

> **_What are your core values?_**

* Client First: we only win when our clients win. We treat client challenges as our own.
* Ownership: we embrace responsibility, taking on challenges, getting them to completion, and enjoying getting things done.
* Quality: we’re passionate about achieving quality outcomes by applying meticulous attention to detail.

children.value: Overview

We're looking for a strong senior-level full stack web developer. Headquartered in Los Angeles, California, Right Balance applies the latest technology and the best engineering practices to help businesses grow. We’re in the top 50 companies to watch in LA.
Project Details

Our client is the customer intelligence partner that empowers businesses to maximize customer-level profitability. The team (former Facebook, PayPal, and Stanford alums) has built a product that can predict individual customer lifetime value at the earliest point of customer contact and change how brands view their relationships with their customer. Using data science to predict future buying behavior of consumers and recommend actions that businesses can take around those predictions. As a full stack web developer, you’ll be responsible for developing robust, scalable full-stack deployment of Serverless web applications using Vue.js, AWS Lambda, Node.js, and FastAPI. Also, want to get your hands dirty with writing some data massaging code using R or Python? We have it as well. In addition to it, you’ll be a part of a team led by an AI technology leader and seasoned hands-on multi-startup CTO with over 15 years of experience.
What’s in it for you
Work with the latest and greatest technologies for a venture-backed startup.
Learn from the best people. We constantly challenge the status quo, learn from each other, and invent new ways of building a great product.
We actually write automated tests. We take advantage of the latest automation tools like automatic deployments, CI/CD pipelines, and more.
Flexible hours. Just join daily standups, sprint planning, and retrospective meetings. Other than that you’re in control of your own schedule.
Work remotely at the comfort of your home or a shared co-working space.
Work on challenging problems, innovate, have fun while doing it.
Travel around the world. We offer occasional business trips to work with our clients face to face from their offices.
Required Qualifications
5+ years of professional full-time hands-on coding experience.
3+ years of web front end development with Vue, React or latest Angular.
3+ years of web backend API development with any of Express / Koa or similar, FastAPI / Django / Flask or similar, Ruby on Rails, PHP (Laravel or Symphony, Yii, not Wordpress).
Advance knowledge of the latest Javascript and/or Typescript language.
The proven history of being productive with multiple languages the right idiomatic way.
Working knowledge of UI/UX best practices and clear understanding of what makes good UX.
Advanced verbal level of English.
Experience working with AWS or GCP or Azure.
Ability to lead by example, understand client’s goals, create and implement solutions to achieve them in a team setting.
Experience working directly with a Product Manager, Designer, QA Engineer, Data Scientists, and Data Engineers in a highly collaborative and proactive way.
Strong knowledge of scalable front end and backend API architecture, best practices, and tools.
Use best practices for writing secure and reliable web applications.
Passion for innovation and execution. Commitment to quality engineering.
Expert level problem solver.
Ability to think and act strategically and proactively.
Nice to haves
1+ year of hands-on Python.
Develop interactive data science visualizations (includes the opportunity to learn the power of R Shiny).
Experience with API integration.
Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related technical field from a top-tier university (or equivalent industry experience at a major technology company).
Expertise in ensuring cross-browser and cross-device compatibility.
Experience in an Agile work environment with automated tests, and CI/CD.
AWS Lambda experience.
Serverless framework experience.
Automated testing.
Runtime complexity analysis using Big O notation.
Frequently Asked Questions
What are your typical clients?

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups at the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company already achieved a product-market fit and is looking to expand rapidly. That’s where we bring the best engineering practices, strong architecture, and the latest technologies to help companies scale.
What is the length of your projects?
Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years.
What’s your company size?

The Right Balance team is 30+ engineers looking to double by the end of the year. The current client size team is over 40 engineers with close to 200 total employees, looking to keep growing fast and aiming to hire up to 150 new employees over the next year. It’s your opportunity to be a part of this growth making meaningful contributions in a team of highly skilled professionals.
What happens if the engagement is completed?
Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current project is ramping down, we’ll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.
What are your core values?

We value autonomy, grind, empathy, mastery, and giving back to the community. We expect you to be autonomous, working directly with the client to build the best product. We value hard work, helping each other, constant learning as well as open-source contributions, and knowledge sharing.

## Overview

We're looking for a strong senior-level full stack web developer. Headquartered in Los Angeles, California, Right Balance applies the latest technology and the best engineering practices to help businesses grow. We’re in the top 50 companies to watch in LA.

## Project Details

Our client is the customer intelligence partner that empowers businesses to maximize customer-level profitability. The team (former Facebook, PayPal, and Stanford alums) has built a product that can predict individual customer lifetime value at the earliest point of customer contact and change how brands view their relationships with their customer. Using data science to predict future buying behavior of consumers and recommend actions that businesses can take around those predictions. As a full stack web developer, you’ll be responsible for developing robust, scalable full-stack deployment of Serverless web applications using Vue.js, AWS Lambda, Node.js, and FastAPI. Also, want to get your hands dirty with writing some data massaging code using R or Python? We have it as well. In addition to it, you’ll be a part of a team led by an AI technology leader and seasoned hands-on multi-startup CTO with over 15 years of experience.

## What’s in it for you

1. Work with the latest and greatest technologies for a venture-backed startup.
2. Learn from the best people. We constantly challenge the status quo, learn from each other, and invent new ways of building a great product.
3. We actually write automated tests. We take advantage of the latest automation tools like automatic deployments, CI/CD pipelines, and more.
4. Flexible hours. Just join daily standups, sprint planning, and retrospective meetings. Other than that you’re in control of your own schedule.
5. Work remotely at the comfort of your home or a shared co-working space.
6. Work on challenging problems, innovate, have fun while doing it.
7. Travel around the world. We offer occasional business trips to work with our clients face to face from their offices.

## Required Qualifications

 1. 5+ years of professional full-time hands-on coding experience.
 2. 3+ years of web front end development with Vue, React or latest Angular.
 3. 3+ years of web backend API development with any of Express / Koa or similar, FastAPI / Django / Flask or similar, Ruby on Rails, PHP (Laravel or Symphony, Yii, not Wordpress).
 4. Advance knowledge of the latest Javascript and/or Typescript language.
 5. The proven history of being productive with multiple languages the right idiomatic way.
 6. Working knowledge of UI/UX best practices and clear understanding of what makes good UX.
 7. Advanced verbal level of English.
 8. Experience working with AWS or GCP or Azure.
 9. Ability to lead by example, understand client’s goals, create and implement solutions to  achieve them in a team setting.
10. Experience working directly with a Product Manager, Designer, QA Engineer, Data Scientists, and Data Engineers in a highly collaborative and proactive way.
11. Strong knowledge of scalable front end and backend API architecture, best practices, and tools.
12. Use best practices for writing secure and reliable web applications.
13. Passion for innovation and execution. Commitment to quality engineering.
14. Expert level problem solver.
15. Ability to think and act strategically and proactively.

## Nice to haves

 1. 1+ year of hands-on Python.
 2. Develop interactive data science visualizations (includes the opportunity to learn the power of R Shiny).
 3. Experience with API integration.
 4. Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related technical field from a top-tier university (or equivalent industry experience at a major technology company).
 5. Expertise in ensuring cross-browser and cross-device compatibility.
 6. Experience in an Agile work environment with automated tests, and CI/CD.
 7. AWS Lambda experience.
 8. Serverless framework experience.
 9. Automated testing.
10. Runtime complexity analysis using Big O notation.

## Frequently Asked Questions

> What are your typical clients?

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups at the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company already achieved a product-market fit and is looking to expand rapidly. That’s where we bring the best engineering practices, strong architecture, and the latest technologies to help companies scale.

> What is the length of your projects?

Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years.

> What’s your company size?

The Right Balance team is 30+ engineers looking to double by the end of the year. The current client size team is over 40 engineers with close to 200 total employees, looking to keep growing fast and aiming to hire up to 150 new employees over the next year. It’s your opportunity to be a part of this growth making meaningful contributions in a team of highly skilled professionals.

> What happens if the engagement is completed?

Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current project is ramping down, we’ll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.

> What are your core values?

We value autonomy, grind, empathy, mastery, and giving back to the community. We expect you to be autonomous, working directly with the client to build the best product. We value hard work, helping each other, constant learning as well as open-source contributions, and knowledge sharing.

4\. 3+ years of experience with React.js (or Vue.js or latest Angular)

5\. Advanced written and verbal level of English. Ability to have a real-time conversation in English.

6\. Ability to have at least 6 hours overlap with the US Pacific Time zone.

## Nice to haves

1\. Experience working with US-based startups.

2\. Tech lead experience.

3\. Team management experience.

4\. Growth stage startup experience.

5\. Industry publications and/or presentations.

6\. Bachelor’s degree in business or related field.


## Frequently Asked Questions

>_What are your typical clients?_

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups in the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company already achieved a product-market fit and is looking to expand rapidly. That’s where we bring the best engineering practices, strong architecture, and the latest technologies to help companies scale. Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years.

>_What’s your company size?_

The Right Balance team is 60+ people going to 100 by the end of 2023.

>_What are your core values?_

Client First: we only win when our clients win. We treat client challenges as our own.

Ownership: we embrace responsibility, taking on challenges, getting them to completion, and enjoying getting things done.

Quality: we’re passionate about achieving quality outcomes by applying meticulous attention to detail.

## Overview
We're looking for a Senior Fullstack Engineer. Headquartered in Los Angeles, California, Right Balance applies the latest technology and best engineering practices to help businesses grow. We’re in the top 50 companies to watch in LA.

## Engagement Details

Our client is building a career platform for employees and recruiters built on the principles of data openness, quantitative evaluation, and self-improvement. The core of the platform is a data augmentation and analytics layer that helps users visualize an individual’s “human capital” with a single, intelligible score. A user's score quantifies their work experience and education, and is further enriched by proprietary data signals to provide a holistic ranking of professionals in the same functional role. Our goal is to help all users understand how everyone “stacks up” without having to parse individual resumes or LinkedIn profiles and ask for referrals or recommendations.

Our company has raised $26M to date–-although we are still pre-product. We have a remote global engineering team of 7 at the moment. Company leadership is based in Los Angeles. We are a fast moving startup that takes pride in a fast iteration style and transparency. We want to work with high-energy do-ers with heavy bias for action.

The backend API is built with Node.js using Nest.js framework. The frontend is React based using Next.js. It’s a green field project with no legacy code. Our data pipeline processes a large amount of data using Python running on AWS. Come join us, it’ll be fun!

## What’s in it for you

1\. Learn and evolve your skills using the latest and greatest technology tools in a rapidly growing company

2\. Learn from the best engineers. We constantly challenge the status quo and invent new ways of building a great product.

3\. Flexible hours. Just join daily standups, sprint planning, and retrospective meetings. Other than that you’re in control of your own schedule

4\. 100% remote. Work anywhere, whether it is remotely in the comfort of your home, in a shared co-working space, in an RV on the beach, or while being a nomad in another country.

5\. Work on challenging problems, innovate, impacting lots of people's lives for the better while having fun doing it.

## Required Qualifications

1\. 7+ years of full-time hands-on software engineering experience.

2\. Upper-intermediate to fluent speaking and writing English. Able to have a real-time conversation.

3\. 3+ years of Nest.js backend experience (or 1+ years of Nest.js and 2+ years of Java / Spring or Go).

4\. 2+ years of full-time hands-on React.js experience.

5\. 1+ years of full-time hands-on Typescript experience.

6\. 1+ years of full-time hands-on PostgreSQL experience.

7\. Experience building scalable, consumer-grade APIs.

8\. Previous experience working in a team larger than 2 people.

9\. Collaborative with focus on iterative approach to problem solving.

10\. Experience building complex, data-driven solutions.

11\. Experience as a tech lead or high ownership ability.

12\. Experience working in startups.

## Nice to haves

1\. Automated testing.

2\. 1+ years of full-time hands-on Nest.js experience.

3\. Experience with FE testing packages like Cypress and Enzyme.

4\. Experience with TDD and/or Integration testing (API level).

5\. GraphQL experience.

6\. Elastic Search experience.

7\. Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent demonstrated ability.

## Frequently Asked Questions

>_What are your typical clients?_

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups in the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company already achieved a product-market fit and is looking to expand rapidly. That’s where we bring the best engineering practices, strong architecture, and the latest technologies to help companies scale.

>_What is the length of your engagements?_

Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years so you are able to evolve your career with the company you are currently working in.

>_What’s your company size?_

The Right Balance team is 60+ engineers going to 200 by the end of the year. The current client size team is 150+ people. The timing is great to be a part of a rapidly growing team making meaningful contributions.

>_What happens if the engagement is completed?_

Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current engagement is ramping down, we’ll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.

>_What are your core values?_

Client First: we only win when our clients win. We treat client challenges as our own.

Ownership: we embrace responsibility, taking on challenges, getting them to completion, and enjoying getting things done.

Quality: we’re passionate about achieving quality outcomes by applying meticulous attention to detail.

We're looking for a Senior Fullstack Engineer. Headquartered in Los Angeles, California, Right Balance applies the latest technology and best engineering practices to help businesses grow. We’re in the top 50 companies to watch in LA.
Engagement Details

Our client has a different vision for eCommerce: enable customer relationships via subscriptions. After listening to exactly what today’s fastest growing brands wanted in an eCommerce subscription platform, we built from the ground up. We’re a passionate group of people using the latest tech stacks to create next-generation eCommerce solutions for our customers like Athletic Greens, Four Sigmatic, True Botanicals and many more. In a few years from now, our company will have helped scale consumer brands the right way through relationships with their most loyal customers, subscribers.

This is the next wave of eCommerce and it’s already here–we’re growing incredibly fast and are looking for bright, enthusiastic people to join us. We do things a little differently around here because that’s what disrupting an industry requires and we like to have fun while building. If you enjoy collaborating with a global team of quirky individuals and share our vision for eCommerce, we’d love to hear from you.

Dive into a large-scale MVC framework. We use Laravel on the backend, running in a containerized environment on AWS in addition to AWS Lambda Serverless functions. Our frontend is written in Vue.js. Your expertise will be put to the test as you create robust, scalable solutions. For the frontend, showcase your skills to create captivating user experiences. Be at the forefront of web development and shape the way our customers interact with our products.

1. Experience the excitement and energy of working in a dynamic startup, where innovative ideas are valued, and your contributions have a direct impact on the company's growth.

3. Learn and evolve your skills using the latest and greatest technology tools in a rapidly growing company.
4. Learn from the best engineers. We constantly challenge the status quo and invent new ways of building a great product.
5. Flexible hours. Just join daily standups, sprint planning, and retrospective meetings. Other than that you’re in control of your own schedule.
6. 100% remote. Work anywhere, whether it is remotely in the comfort of your home, in a shared co-working space, in an RV on the beach, or while being a nomad in another country.
7. Work on challenging problems, innovate, impacting lots of people's lives for the better while having fun doing it.
Required Qualifications
1. 10+ years of full-time hands-on Fullstack experience
2. Advanced speaking and writing English. Able to have a real-time conversation.
3. 5+ years of full-time hands-on experience with large-scale MVC frameworks such as Laravel, Ruby-on-Rails, Django, Node.Js backend, Java/spring.
4. 3+ years of full-time hands-on experience with Vue.Js, React.Js or Angular.
5. 2+ years of full-time hands-on Shopify integration experience.
6. 2+ years of full-time hands-on Cloud experience (AWS, GCP, or Azure).
7. 5+ years of full-time hands-on SQL experience.
8. Experience building robust RESTful APIs.
9. Experience with MySQL or PostgreSQL (monitoring/scaling databases and writing/optimizing SQL queries).
10. Startup mentality - self-starter, sense of ownership, team player.
Nice to haves
1. Serverless experience.
2. Experience with subscription services (e.g., Recharge, Smartrr, Skio, etc.)
3. Experience designing, deploying, and maintaining cloud infrastructure on AWS in support of containerized applications.
4. Experience with Git and version control best practices, code-based CI/CD tools, and deploying code to multiple environments.
5. Experience with GraphQL.
6. Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent demonstrated ability.

We are a USA-based company producing video solutions with the mission to advance scientific research and education. Our institutional clients comprise over 1,000 universities, colleges, and biopharma companies, including such leaders as Harvard, MIT, Yale, and Stanford. As a rapidly growing company, with offices in the USA, UK, Australia, and India servicing clients in over 60 countries, we are seeking talented individuals to join our company.

We are looking for an experienced Senior Fullstack Engineer to help lead, develop, implement, and maintain a variety of applications, services and APIs used within our global content platform. You will work closely with all company departments to learn and understand the requirements needed to grow our current apps. If you are the kind of lead engineer who is passionate about bringing great products to life, being a rockstar engineer who loves working in a collaborative environment with your product partners and dependency teams, then we want to talk to you. Join us, it will be fun!

## **_What’s in it for you_**

1. Work with the latest and greatest technologies.
2. Learn from the best people. We constantly challenge the status quo, learn from each other, and invent new ways of building a great product.
3. We actually write automated tests. We take advantage of the latest automation tools like automatic deployments, CI/CD pipelines, and more.
4. Work remotely in the comfort of your home or a shared co-working space.
5. Work on challenging problems, innovate, and have fun while doing it.
6. Travel around the world. We offer occasional business trips to work with our clients face-to-face from their offices.

## **_Required Qualifications_**

 1. 5+ years of experience working as a full-stack engineer.
 2. 3+ years of experience with back-end with PHP, using any tools like Lavarel,and Codeigniter (we use Symfony).
 3. 2+ years of experience with front-end (we use React).
 4. 1+ years of experience utilizing SQL.
 5. Understanding and implementation of cloud-native architectures (we use AWS serverless and containers) at scale in production.
 6. Demonstrated understanding and implementation of software design principles such as SOLID and DRY with Software as a Service (SaaS), multi-tenancy application development.
 7. Embraces the concepts of Agile Scrum software development and its related collaboration and issue tracking tools (e.g., JIRA, Rally).
 8. Experience working in a Continuous Integration / Continuous Delivery (CICD) model, including GitHub and CI pipeline automation tools.
 9. Ability to triage and resolve incidents and lead incident investigations.
10. Must be able to ensure Agile/Scrum concepts and principles are adhered to, must be able to be a voice of reason.
11. Experience working in a 24/7 on-call, highly transactional or streaming production environment.
12. Experience integrating with 3rd party APIs, external frameworks, and libraries.
13. Experience with data-driven architecture and systems design, RESTful APIs, and microservices architecture.

## **_Nice to haves_**

1. Building a Kubernetes Operator is a plus.
2. GraphQL experience.
3. NoSQL experience.
4. Experience working as a technical team lead in a squad.

## **_Frequently Asked Questions_**

**What are your typical clients?**

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups in the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company has already achieved a product-market fit and is looking to expand rapidly. That’s where we bring the best engineering practices, strong architecture, and the latest technologies to help companies scale.

**What is the length of your engagements?**

Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years.

**What’s your company size?**

The Right Balance team has 40+ engineers going to 100+ by the end of the year. The current client team size is 25 engineers, expanding to 50 engineers by the end of this year. It’s exciting to be a part of this growth making some meaningful contributions.

**What happens if the engagement is completed?**

Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current engagement is ramping down, we’ll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.

**What are your core values?**

* Client First: we only win when our clients win. We treat client challenges as our own.
* Ownership: we embrace responsibility, taking on challenges, getting them to completion, and enjoying getting things done.
* Quality: we’re passionate about achieving quality outcomes by applying meticulous attention to detail.

The day-to-day responsibilities are broad, and you will ultimately be responsible for shipping software

Our frontend is in React.js, the backend is in Node.js, so get your Javascript on! Solve interesting challenges in a rapid growth environment. We have greenfield development of new product modules using the latest tools and frameworks.

Come join us, it’ll be fun!

## What’s in it for you

7+ years of full-time hands-on Software Engineering experience.

5\. Unit testing experience.

6\. Experience working in startups.

2\. Code complexity, big O notation.

3\. Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent demonstrated ability.

4\. Excellent verbal & written communication skills.

That’s where we bring the best engineering practices, strong architecture, and the latest technologies to help companies scale.

>_What is the length of your engagements?_

Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years so you are able to evolve your career with the company you are currently working in.

Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current engagement is ramping down, we’ll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.

_data.title: Senior Python Engineer

children.value: Overview
We're looking for a strong senior-level Python engineer. Headquartered in
Los Angeles, California, Right Balance applies the latest technology and the best engineering practices to help businesses grow. We’re in the top 50 companies to watch in LA.
Project Details

Our client just raised a $50M series B round of funding and is looking to double the engineering team in the next 6 months. It’s your chance to join a high-quality engineering team with the hands-on CTO from SpaceX, MySpace, and Honest Company.

Text messaging adoption is growing rapidly. Now, an average person spends 23 hours a week texting. The product is a text messaging automation software platform allowing E-Commerce store owners to do most of their customer communication over text messaging as opposed to old-school calls and emails.
The technology stack is React.js on the front end with Redux Saga, Storybooks, slick-looking UI with a custom design system, and an AI-powered conversation builder using the Canvas API.

The front end is powered by Python / Django backend API on top of a PostgreSQL database with Kafka processing high throughput text messages at the scale of 10s of millions messages per day. Soon we’ll be adding NoSQL and Kubernetes into the mix. Join us, it’ll be a lot of fun!
What’s in it for you
1. Work with the latest and greatest technologies.
2. Learn from the best people. We constantly challenge the status quo, learn from each other, and invent new ways of building a great product.
3. We actually write automated tests. We take advantage of the latest automation tools like automatic deployments, CI/CD pipelines, and more.
4. Flexible hours. Just join daily standups, sprint planning, and retrospective meetings.
Other than that you’re in control of your own schedule.
5. Work remotely at the comfort of your home or a shared co-working space.
6. Work on challenging problems, innovate, have fun while doing it.
7. Travel around the world. We offer occasional business trips to work with our clients face to face from their offices.
Required Qualifications
1. 5+ years of full time hands-on backend experience.
2. 4+ years of full time hands-on experience with Python, Django (of Flask or FastAPI).
3. Ability to write clean, modular, scalable, well-tested code, setting an example for others.
4. Ability to lead by example, understand client’s goals, create and implement solutions to achieve them in a team setting.
5. Experience working directly with a Product Manager, Designer, QA Engineer in a highly collaborative and proactive way.
6. Strong knowledge of scalable backend API architecture, best practices, and tools.
7. Upper-intermediate to fluent speaking and writing English.
8. Experience with automated testing.
9. Clear understanding of the runtime complexity of the code being written.
10. Ability to think outside of the box and work on the same project long term with a high degree of care.
Nice to haves
1. A formal Computer Science degree.
2. Working experience in a proper Agile / Scrum team environment.
3. Deep understanding of automated testing, ability to set up automated testing frameworks, testing architecture, data seeding, mocking, and implementing best testing practices.
4. Deep understanding of runtime complexity and memory complexity using Big O notation.
5. Growth stage startup experience.
6. Technical leadership experience.
7. Team management experience.
8. Open source contributions, presentations, and publications.
Frequently Asked Questions
What are your typical clients?

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups at the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company already achieved a product-market fit and looking to expand rapidly. That’s where we bring the best engineering practices, strong architecture, and the latest technologies to help companies scale.
What is the length of your projects?
Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years.
What’s your company size?
The Right Balance team is 10 - 15 engineers. The current client size team is 20 people looking to double it this year. It’s exciting to be a part of this growth making some meaningful contributions.
What happens if the engagement is completed?
Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current project is ramping down, we’ll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.
What are your core values?

We value autonomy, grind, empathy, mastery, and giving back to the community. We expect you to be autonomous, working directly with the client to build the best product. We value hard work, helping each other, constant learning as well as open-source contributions, and knowledge sharing.

# Overview

We're looking for a strong Senior QA Automation Engineer. Headquartered in Los Angeles, California, Right Balance applies the latest technology and the best practices to help businesses grow. We’re in the top 50 companies to watch in LA.

Our client is a rapidly growing SaaS startup that raised a $25.9M Series B round funding. They enable the world’s top real estate agents and brokers with award winning websites and cutting edge technology to manage their online presence. Moving fast to be a one stop shop for everything from websites to marketing services, they are already the official website partner to powerful brokerages like Compass, Corcoran, Sotheby’s, and Coldwell Banker.

As a Senior QA Automation Engineer, you will be part of a team that is fully immersed in the challenges of abstracting HTML/CSS enabling real estate agents to build and customize their website. You will architect and develop tools, frameworks, and automated testing infrastructure to facilitate smooth software delivery. You’ll be joining the Website Product squad owning an engine responsible for rendering more than 2000 static pages a minute.

If you are interested in defining the automated testing strategy for web applications including contract testing for microservices, working jointly with team members, join us!

# What’s in it for you

1. Work with the latest and greatest technology tools for a venture-backed startup.
2. Learn from the best people. We constantly challenge the status quo, learn from each other, and invent new ways of building a great product.
3. Flexible hours. Just join daily standups, sprint planning, and retrospective meetings. Other than that you’re in control of your own schedule.
4. Work remotely at the comfort of your home or a shared co-working space.
5. Work on challenging problems, innovate, have fun while doing it.
6. Travel around the world. We offer occasional business trips to work with our clients face to face from their offices.

# Required Qualifications

1. 5+ years of full-time hands experience in QA.
2. 2+ years of Javascript experience (using Cypress or Selenium).
3. Upper-intermediate to Advanced level of verbal English.
4. Fluent in Javascript.
5. Experience with CI/CD environments (we use CircleCI).
6. Proficiency in multiple test automation tools and frameworks.
7. Experience in developing test strategies, test plans, and test cases.
8. Proven success working in Agile environments (Scrum, Kanban, etc.).
9. Experience with the Page Object pattern and designing test suites.

# Nice to haves

1. Experience with Cloud platforms such as AWS.

# Frequently Asked Questions

_What are your typical clients?_

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups at the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company already achieved a product-market fit and is looking to expand rapidly. That’s where we bring the best engineering practices, strong architecture, and the latest technologies to help companies scale.

_What is the length of your engagements?_

Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years.

_What’s your company size?_

The Right Balance team has 50+ engineers going to 100+ by the end of the year. The current client team size is 20+ engineers, expanding to 50. It’s exciting to be a part of this growth making some meaningful contributions.

_What happens if the engagement is completed?_

Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current project is ramping down, we’ll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.

_What are your core values?_

Client First: we only win when our clients win. We treat client challenges as our own.

Ownership: we embrace responsibility, taking on challenges, getting them to completion, and enjoying getting things done.

Quality: we’re passionate about achieving quality outcomes by applying meticulous attention to detail.

As a rapidly growing company, with offices in the USA, UK, Australia, and India servicing clients in over 60 countries, we are seeking talented individuals to join our company.

This position will kickstart the QA in the company and will fully automate test cases in time. The technology stack is React.js on the front end with Redux Saga, Storybooks, slick-looking UI with a custom design system, and an AI-powered conversation builder using the Canvas API.

The front end is powered by Python / Django backend API on top of a PostgreSQL database with Kafka processing high throughput text messages at the scale of 10s of millions of messages per day. Soon we’ll be adding NoSQL and Kubernetes into the mix. Join us, it’ll be a lot of fun!
What’s in it for you
Work with the latest and greatest technologies.
Learn from the best people. We constantly challenge the status quo, learn from each other, and invent new ways of building a great product.
We actually write automated tests. We take advantage of the latest automation tools like automatic deployments, CI/CD pipelines, and more.
Flexible hours. Just join daily standups, sprint planning, and retrospective meetings. Other than that you’re in control of your own schedule.
Work remotely at the comfort of your home or a shared co-working space.
Work on challenging problems, innovate, have fun while doing it.
Travel around the world. We offer occasional business trips to work with our clients face to face from their offices.
Required Qualifications
4+ years full-time hands-on Quality Assurance experience.
2+ years full-time hands-on experience in a Technical Analyst role.
2+ years of experience using SQL with extensive experience in analytical techniques.
1+ years full-time hands-on experience with Cypress.
1+ years of Cloud Assurance experience.
Intermediate to fluent speaking and writing English.
Deep understanding of SDLC and experience applying that to execute test strategies.
Proven track record of mitigating risks.
Proven track record of test techniques.
Proven track record of implementing successful test strategies including test plans and tools.
Experience working with remote development teams.
Experience with strategic goal setting and execution.
Experience working directly with a Product Manager, Designer, Engineer, etc in a highly collaborative and proactive way.
Strong desire to take ownership and responsibility.
Ability to think outside of the box and work on the same project long term with a high degree of care.
Nice to haves
B.S. in Computer Science or math.
Ability to read/write code in Python and JavaScript.
Understand testing concepts in applying test automation (risk assessment, priorities assessment, etc).
Familiarity with cloud monitoring tools such as DataDog, CloudWatch, etc.
Experience working with AWS.
ISTQB Foundation Level.
Growth stage startup experience.
Technical leadership experience.
Team management experience.
Open source contributions, presentations, and publications.
Frequently Asked Questions
What are your typical clients?

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups at the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company already achieved a product-market fit and is looking to expand rapidly. That’s where we bring the best engineering practices, strong architecture, and the latest technologies to help companies scale.
What is the length of your projects?
Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years.
What’s your company size?

The Right Balance team is 30+ engineers looking to double by the end of the year. The current client size team is over 40 engineers with close to 200 total employees, looking to keep growing fast and aiming to hire up to 150 new employees over the next year. It’s your opportunity to be a part of this growth making meaningful contributions in a team of highly skilled professionals.
What happens if the engagement is completed?
Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current project is ramping down, we’ll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.

We value autonomy, grind, empathy, mastery, and giving back to the community. We expect you to be autonomous, working directly with the client to build the best product. We value hard work, helping each other, constant learning as well as open-source contributions, and knowledge sharing.

## Overview

We're looking for a strong senior-level QA Engineer. Headquartered in Los Angeles, California, Right Balance applies the latest technology and the best engineering practices to help businesses grow. We’re in the top 50 companies to watch in LA.

## Project Details

Our client just raised a $50M series B round of funding and is looking to double the engineering team in the next 6 months. It’s your chance to join a high-quality engineering team with the hands-on CTO from SpaceX, MySpace, and Honest Company.

Text messaging adoption is growing rapidly. Now, an average person spends 23 hours a week texting. The product is a text messaging automation software platform allowing E-Commerce store owners to do most of their customer communication over text messaging as opposed to old-school calls and emails.

The technology stack is React.js on the front end with Redux Saga, Storybooks, slick-looking UI with a custom design system, and an AI-powered conversation builder using the Canvas API.

The front end is powered by Python / Django backend API on top of a PostgreSQL database with Kafka processing high throughput text messages at the scale of 10s of millions of messages per day. Soon we’ll be adding NoSQL and Kubernetes into the mix. Join us, it’ll be a lot of fun!

## What’s in it for you

1. Work with the latest and greatest technologies.
2. Learn from the best people. We constantly challenge the status quo, learn from each other, and invent new ways of building a great product.
3. We actually write automated tests. We take advantage of the latest automation tools like automatic deployments, CI/CD pipelines, and more.
4. Flexible hours. Just join daily standups, sprint planning, and retrospective meetings. Other than that you’re in control of your own schedule.
5. Work remotely at the comfort of your home or a shared co-working space.
6. Work on challenging problems, innovate, have fun while doing it.
7. Travel around the world. We offer occasional business trips to work with our clients face to face from their offices.

## Required Qualifications

 2. 2+ years full-time hands-on experience in a Technical Analyst role.

 4. 1+ years full-time hands-on experience with Cypress.
 5. 1+ years of Cloud Assurance experience.
 6. Intermediate to fluent speaking and writing English.
 7. Deep understanding of SDLC and experience applying that to execute test strategies.
 8. Proven track record of mitigating risks.

10. Proven track record of implementing successful test strategies including test plans and tools.
11. Experience working with remote development teams.
12. Experience with strategic goal setting and execution.
13. Experience working directly with a Product Manager, Designer, Engineer, etc in a highly collaborative and proactive way.
14. Strong desire to take ownership and responsibility.
15. Ability to think outside of the box and work on the same project long term with a high degree of care.

## Nice to haves

 1. B.S. in Computer Science or math.
 2. Ability to read/write code in Python and JavaScript.
 3. Understand testing concepts in applying test automation (risk assessment, priorities assessment, etc).
 4. Familiarity with cloud monitoring tools such as DataDog, CloudWatch, etc.
 5. Experience working with AWS.
 6. ISTQB Foundation Level.
 7. Growth stage startup experience.
 8. Technical leadership experience.
 9. Team management experience.
10. Open source contributions, presentations, and publications.

## Frequently Asked Questions

> What are your typical clients?

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups at the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company already achieved a product-market fit and is looking to expand rapidly. That’s where we bring the best engineering practices, strong architecture, and the latest technologies to help companies scale.

> What is the length of your projects?

Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years.

> What’s your company size?

The Right Balance team is 30+ engineers looking to double by the end of the year. The current client size team is over 40 engineers with close to 200 total employees, looking to keep growing fast and aiming to hire up to 150 new employees over the next year. It’s your opportunity to be a part of this growth making meaningful contributions  in a team of highly skilled professionals.

> What happens if the engagement is completed?

Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current project is ramping down, we’ll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.

> What are your core values?

We value autonomy, grind, empathy, mastery, and giving back to the community. We expect you to be autonomous, working directly with the client to build the best product. We value hard work, helping each other, constant learning as well as open-source contributions, and knowledge sharing.

We are a leading independent, on-demand technology support service. Available 24/7 both in-home and remote, our company has a massive network of expert technicians nationwide dedicated to providing a top-notch customer experience for a wide range of services, including computer support, smart home device installation, home office setup, and more.
With both direct-to-consumer presence and deep integrations with retailers such as Walmart.com and Comcast Xfinity, we eliminate the headaches and hassle of product installation and maintenance.

We're seeking a senior QA engineer that knows both manual and automation testing, is able to write and execute test cases and automate them gradually, and can think critically about how to best support and enable software development while maintaining high quality and predictability. Join us, it will be fun!

Work with the latest and greatest technologies.

Travel around the world. We offer occasional business trips to work with our clients face-to-face from their offices.

5+ years of manual testing
1+ years of experience working with Cypress
Ability to plan, design, and execute testing of software apps including mobile and desktop.
Strong hands-on manual functional testing experience
Strong testing automation experience via Cypress
Experience with Scrum or other agile methodology
Knowledge of SQL, web services, and automation frameworks
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Review and analyze requirements and user stories, providing feedback to influence toward better understanding and testability of features and changes
Write, maintain, and execute test plans for new existing features and update existing test plans that change
Maintain a mindset to always improve and communicate throughout the development process
Nice to haves
Experience in API and back-end testing
A formal Computer Science or equivalent degree

What are your typical clients?

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups in the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company has already achieved a product-market fit and is looking to expand rapidly. That’s where we bring the best engineering practices, strong architecture, and the latest technologies to help companies scale.
What is the length of your engagements?
Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years.
What’s your company size?
The Right Balance team has 60+ engineers going to 100+ by the end of the year. It’s exciting to be a part of a solid engineering team making meaningful contributions.
What happens if the engagement is completed?
Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current engagement is ramping down, we’ll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.
What are your core values?

● Client First: we only win when our clients win. We treat client challenges as our own. ● Ownership: we embrace responsibility, taking on challenges, getting them to completion, and enjoying getting things done. ● Quality: we’re passionate about achieving quality outcomes by applying meticulous attention to detail.

Some of our services use Azure functions, as well as running in containers on Kubernetes. Having a lot of fun doing it, join us!

1. Work with the latest and greatest technologies.
2. Learn from the best people. We constantly challenge the status quo, learn from each other, and invent new ways of building a great product.

5. Work on challenging problems, innovate, have fun while doing it.
6. Travel around the world. We offer occasional business trips to work with our clients face to face from their offices.

1. 4+ years of professional full-time experience doing manual QA.
2. 2+ years of SQL experience.
3. Upper-intermediate to fluent speaking and writing English.
4. Full understanding of SDLC.
5. Full understanding of QA strategy.
6. Full understanding of the quality test cycle.
7. Experience creating and documenting test cases.
8. Strong analytical abilities.
9. Knowledge and understanding of automated testing and how it works together with the QA strategy.
10. Basic understanding of the software architecture.
11. Solid troubleshooting skills.
Nice to haves
1. A formal Computer Science or equivalent degree.
2. Zephyr experience.
3. CI/CD system experience (we use Azure Pipelines)
4. Cloud experience (preferably Azure)
5. API Testing experience with Postman (SOAP and Rest)
6. Selenium or equivalent experience
7. Software development familiarity.
Frequently Asked Questions
What are your typical clients?

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups at the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company already achieved a product-market fit and is looking to expand rapidly. That’s where we bring the best engineering practices, strong architecture, and the latest technologies to help companies scale.

Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years.

## Overview

We're looking for a Senior QA Manual Engineer to join our team. Headquartered in Los Angeles, California, Right Balance applies the latest technology and the best engineering practices to help businesses grow. We’re in the top 50 companies to watch in LA.

## Project Details

Our client is a leading software solutions provider in the online advertising market. The platform streamlines the ad sales processes for some of the most prominent publishers on the Web.

We’re committed to continuous innovation by using the latest technologies in the cloud arena. We’re moving to microservices, optimizing the flow of data in the AdTech stack to connect publishers and advertisers in a meaningful way.

You'll be working with a large scale system involving a lot of features, working with terabytes of data in our database. Performance is important for our team, as well as scalability. Constantly challenging the status quo, we're always improving our processes. Your voice will be heard.

You'll make an impact on the team by utilizing your technological experience.

Our stack is .NET on the backend, moving to .NET Core with SQL Server deployed to Azure Cloud. On the frontend, we’re using Vue.js. Our release pipeline is streamlined with CI/CD running on Azure pipelines. For our infrastructure, we believe in managing it as code, currently using Terraform to do so. Some of our services use Azure functions, as well as running in containers on Kubernetes. Having a lot of fun doing it, join us!

## What’s in it for you

1\. Work with the latest and greatest technologies.

2\. Learn from the best people. We constantly challenge the status quo, learn from each other, and invent new ways of building a great product.

3\. We actually write automated tests. We take advantage of the latest automation tools like automatic deployments, CI/CD pipelines, and more.

4\. Work remotely at the comfort of your home or a shared co-working space.

5\. Work on challenging problems, innovate, have fun while doing it.

6\. Travel around the world. We offer occasional business trips to work with our clients face to face from their offices.

## Required Qualifications

1\. 4+ years of professional full-time experience doing manual QA.

2\. 2+ years of SQL experience.

3\. Upper-intermediate to fluent speaking and writing English.

4\. Full understanding of SDLC.

5\. Full understanding of QA strategy.

6\. Full understanding of the quality test cycle.

7\. Experience creating and documenting test cases.

8\. Strong analytical abilities.

9\. Knowledge and understanding of automated testing and how it works together with the QA strategy.

10\. Basic understanding of the software architecture.

11\. Solid troubleshooting skills.

## Nice to haves

1\. A formal Computer Science or equivalent degree.

2\. Zephyr experience.

3\. CI/CD system experience (we use Azure Pipelines)

4\. Cloud experience (preferably Azure)

5\. API Testing experience with Postman (SOAP and Rest)

6\. Selenium or equivalent experience

7\. Software development familiarity.

## Frequently Asked Questions

> What are your typical clients?

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups at the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company already achieved a product-market fit and is looking to expand rapidly. That’s where we bring the best engineering practices, strong architecture, and the latest technologies to help companies scale.

> _What is the length of your projects?_

Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years.

> _What’s your company size?_

The Right Balance team is 10 - 15 engineers. The current client team size is 30 engineers expanding to 50 engineers by the end of this year . It’s exciting to be a part of this growth making some meaningful contributions.

> _What happens if the engagement is completed?_

Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current project is ramping down, we’ll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.

> _What are your core values?_

We value autonomy, grind, empathy, mastery, and giving back to the community. We expect you to be autonomous, working directly with the client to build the best product. We value hard work, helping each other, constant learning as well as open-source contributions, and knowledge sharing.

_data.text:
## Overview

We're looking for a strong senior-level React engineer. Headquartered in

Los Angeles, California, Right Balance applies the latest technology and the best engineering practices to help businesses grow. We’re in the top 50 companies to watch in LA.

## Project Details

Our client just raised a $50M series B round of funding and is looking to double the engineering team in the next 6 months. It’s your chance to join a high-quality engineering team with the hands-on CTO from SpaceX, MySpace, and Honest Company.

Text messaging adoption is growing rapidly. Now, an average person spends 23 hours a week texting. The product is a text messaging automation software platform allowing E-Commerce store owners to do most of their customer communication over text messaging as opposed to old-school calls and emails.

The technology stack is React.js on the front end with Redux Saga, Storybooks, slick-looking UI with a custom design system, and an AI-powered conversation builder using the Canvas API.

The front end is powered by Python / Django backend API on top of a PostgreSQL database with Kafka processing high throughput text messages at the scale of 10s of millions of messages per day. Soon we’ll be adding NoSQL and Kubernetes into the mix. Join us, it’ll be a lot of fun!

## What’s in it for you

1\. Work with the latest and greatest technologies.

2\. Learn from the best people. We constantly challenge the status quo, learn from each other, and invent new ways of building a great product.

3\. We actually write automated tests. We take advantage of the latest automation tools like automatic deployments, CI/CD pipelines, and more.

4\. Flexible hours. Just join daily standups, sprint planning, and retrospective meetings.

Other than that you’re in control of your own schedule.

5\. Work remotely at the comfort of your home or a shared co-working space.

6\. Work on challenging problems, innovate, have fun while doing it.

7\. Travel around the world. We offer occasional business trips to work with our clients face to face from their offices.

## Required Qualifications

1\. 5+ years of full time hands on coding experience.

2\. 4+ years of full time experience with React.js, Redux, CSS, HTML, and Javascript.

3\. Ability to write clean, modular, scalable, well-tested code, setting an example for others.

4\. Ability to lead by example, understand client’s goals, create and implement solutions to achieve them in a team setting.

5\. Experience working directly with a Product Manager, Designer, QA Engineer in a highly collaborative and proactive way.

6\. Strong knowledge of scalable front-end architecture, best UI/UX practices, and tools.

7\. Upper-intermediate to fluent speaking and writing English.

8\. Experience with automated testing.

9\. Clear understanding of the runtime complexity of the code being written.

10\. Ability to think outside of the box and work on the same project long term with a high degree of care.

## Nice to haves

1\. A formal Computer Science degree.

2\. Working experience in a proper Agile / Scrum team environment.

3\. Deep understanding of automated testing, ability to set up automated testing frameworks, testing architecture, data seeding, mocking, and implementing best testing practices.

4\. Deep understanding of runtime complexity and memory complexity using Big O notation.

5\. Growth stage startup experience.

6\. Technical leadership experience.

7\. Team management experience.

8\. Open source contributions, presentations, and publications.

## Frequently Asked Questions

>_What are your typical clients?_

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups at the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company already achieved a product-market fit and is looking to expand rapidly. That’s where we bring the best engineering practices, strong architecture, and the latest technologies to help companies scale.

>_What is the length of your projects?_

Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years.

>_What’s your company size?_

The Right Balance team is 10 - 15 engineers. The current client team size is 30 engineers expanding to 50 engineers by the end of this year . It’s exciting to be a part of this growth making some meaningful contributions.

>_What happens if the engagement is completed?_

Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current project is ramping down, we’ll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.

>_What are your core values?_

We value autonomy, grind, empathy, mastery, and giving back to the community. We expect you to be autonomous, working directly with the client to build the best product. We value hard work, helping each other, constant learning as well as open-source contributions, and knowledge sharing.

Customer experience mindset.

languages including but not limited to: C/C++, Java, Python, JavaScript, Go, Rust,
Objective-C and/or Swift.

Big O notation.

What are your typical clients?

# Frequently Asked Questions

What are your typical clients?

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups at the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company already achieved a product-market fit and is looking to expand rapidly. That’s where we bring the best engineering practices, strong architecture, and the latest technologies to help companies scale.

What is the length of your engagements?

Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years.

What’s your company size?

The Right Balance team has 50+ engineers going to 100+ by the end of the year. The current client size team is 15+ people. This is an opportunity to build some foundational IoT technology in a small team of seasoned professionals.

What happens if the engagement is completed?

Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current project is ramping down, we’ll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.

What are your core values?

We value autonomy, grind, empathy, mastery, and giving back to the community. We expect you to be autonomous, working directly with the client to build the best product. We value hard work, helping each other, constant learning as well as open-source contributions, and knowledge sharing.

_data.title: Senior Software Engineer, Fullstack

children.value: Overview

We're looking for a Senior Software Engineer, Fullstack. Headquartered in Los Angeles, California, Right Balance applies the latest technology and best engineering practices to help businesses grow. We’re in the top 50 companies to watch in LA.
Engagement Details

Our mission is to make life better. We’re creating a world where laundry actually gets done by people who enjoy doing it. We're the first nationwide marketplace for a personal laundry service, serving over 500+ cities throughout the United States. And we’re just getting started. We’re looking to grow our team with smart, fun, and innovative minds looking to make a real difference.

We strive to be an inclusive and diverse work environment full of ideas that challenge our assumptions while quickly acknowledging our mistakes. It’s a place where everyone receives guidance and feedback that is kind, specific, and sincere. While we all have individual priorities and areas of expertise, we're committed to the overarching idea that we learn today to be better tomorrow. The core values we hold shape our company culture, drive team cohesion and encourage personal growth.

We stand as frontrunners in the industry, consistently pushing the boundaries of innovation and maintaining a leading edge over our competitors. Thrive in a dynamic growth-oriented setting, constructing solutions that are designed for scalability. You will be among the first employees at a fast-growing startup. Make a key impact at a fast-growing consumer marketplace startup. Contribute significantly to impactful projects that directly enhance people's lives, all while harnessing cutting-edge technologies, collaborating with an exceptional team of engineers. Your voice will be heard. Our environment is fast-paced, providing you with ongoing opportunities to learn and embrace new challenges. As the company progresses, expands, and matures, you'll find limitless prospects for personal and professional development.
Besides all learning opportunities for new tech, you will be working with Angular & Ionic for the frontend, Node.js for the backend, and Typescript all around.
What’s in it for you
1. Learn and evolve your skills using the latest and greatest technology tools in a rapidly growing company
2. Learn from the best engineers. We constantly challenge the status quo and invent new ways of building a great product.
3. Flexible hours. Just join daily standups, sprint planning, and retrospective meetings. Other than that you’re in control of your own schedule
4. 100% remote. Work anywhere, whether it is remotely in the comfort of your home, in a shared co-working space, in an RV on the beach, or while being a nomad in another country.
5. Work on challenging problems, innovate, impacting lots of people's lives for the better while having fun doing it.
Required Qualifications
Upper-intermediate to fluent speaking and writing English. Able to have a real-time conversation.
5+ years of hands-on full-time Software Engineering experience.
3+ years of hands-on full-time experience with Typescript.
2+ years of hands-on full-time experience with Angular (or any of React, Vue, Ionic, React Native).
2+ years of hands-on full-time experience with Node.js.
1+ years of hands-on full-time experience with NoSQL.
Good understanding of software design patterns and best practices.
Ability to work on a project while responding to requests and incidents.
Able to improve processes to minimize the impact of daily requests and incidents on project work.
Must be willing to participate in a rotating on-call schedule.
Willingness to work with Angular only (not React, not Vue).
Ownership: ability to proactively figure out the requirements and get things to completion without much supervision, guidance, or encouragement.
Working Knowledge of promises and observables (RxJS).
Aptitude to learn new technologies and apply the right tool for the job.
Nice to haves
1. Ionic experience.
2. Mobile development experience.
3. Android experience using Kotlin or Java.
4. iOS experience using Swift.
5. Experience working on a two-sided consumer marketplace.
6. Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent demonstrated ability.
Frequently Asked Questions
What are your typical clients?

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups at the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company already achieved a product-market fit and is looking to expand rapidly. That’s where we bring the best engineering practices, strong architecture, and the latest technologies to help companies scale.
What is the length of your engagements?
Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years so you are able to evolve your career with the company you are currently working in.
What’s your company size?

The Right Balance team is 60+ engineers going to 100 by the end of the year. The current client size engineering team is around 15 people. The timing is great to be a part of a rapidly growing team making meaningful contributions.
What happens if the engagement is completed?
Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current engagement is ramping down, we’ll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.
What are your core values?
Client First: we only win when our clients win. We treat client challenges as our own.
Ownership: we embrace responsibility, taking on challenges, getting them to completion, and enjoying getting things done.
Quality: we’re passionate about achieving quality outcomes by applying meticulous attention to detail.
