## Overview

We're looking for a Senior Software Engineer, Fullstack. Headquartered in Los Angeles, California, Right Balance applies the latest technology and best engineering practices to help businesses grow. We’re in the top 50 companies to watch in LA.

## Engagement Details

Our mission is to make life better. We’re creating a world where laundry actually gets done by people who enjoy doing it. We're the first nationwide marketplace for a personal laundry service, serving over 500+ cities throughout the United States. And we’re just getting started. We’re looking to grow our team with smart, fun, and innovative minds looking to make a real difference.

We strive to be an inclusive and diverse work environment full of ideas that challenge our assumptions while quickly acknowledging our mistakes. It’s a place where everyone receives guidance and feedback that is kind, specific, and sincere. While we all have individual priorities and areas of expertise, we're committed to the overarching idea that we learn today to be better tomorrow. The core values we hold shape our company culture, drive team cohesion and encourage personal growth.

We stand as frontrunners in the industry, consistently pushing the boundaries of innovation and maintaining a leading edge over our competitors. Thrive in a dynamic growth-oriented setting, constructing solutions that are designed for scalability. You will be among the first employees at a fast-growing startup. Make a key impact at a fast-growing consumer marketplace startup. Contribute significantly to impactful projects that directly enhance people's lives, all while harnessing cutting-edge technologies, collaborating with an exceptional team of engineers. Your voice will be heard. Our environment is fast-paced, providing you with ongoing opportunities to learn and embrace new challenges. As the company progresses, expands, and matures, you'll find limitless prospects for personal and professional development.

Besides all learning opportunities for new tech, you will be working with Angular & Ionic for the frontend, Node.js for the backend, and Typescript all around.

## What’s in it for you

1\. Learn and evolve your skills using the latest and greatest technology tools in a rapidly growing company

2\. Learn from the best engineers. We constantly challenge the status quo and invent new ways of building a great product.

3\. Flexible hours. Just join daily standups, sprint planning, and retrospective meetings. Other than that you’re in control of your own schedule

4\. 100% remote. Work anywhere, whether it is remotely in the comfort of your home, in a shared co-working space, in an RV on the beach, or while being a nomad in another country.

5\. Work on challenging problems, innovate, impacting lots of people's lives for the better while having fun doing it.

## Required Qualifications

- Upper-intermediate to fluent speaking and writing English. Able to have a real-time conversation.

- 5+ years of hands-on full-time Software Engineering experience.

- 3+ years of hands-on full-time experience with Typescript.

- 2+ years of hands-on full-time experience with Angular (or any of React, Vue, Ionic, React Native).

- 2+ years of hands-on full-time experience with Node.js.

- 1+ years of hands-on full-time experience with NoSQL.

- Good understanding of software design patterns and best practices.

- Ability to work on a project while responding to requests and incidents.

- Able to improve processes to minimize the impact of daily requests and incidents on project work.

- Must be willing to participate in a rotating on-call schedule.

- Willingness to work with Angular only (not React, not Vue).

- Ownership: ability to proactively figure out the requirements and get things to completion without much supervision, guidance, or encouragement.

- Working Knowledge of promises and observables (RxJS).

- Aptitude to learn new technologies and apply the right tool for the job.

## Nice to haves

1\. Ionic experience.

2\. Mobile development experience.

3\. Android experience using Kotlin or Java.

4\. iOS experience using Swift.

5\. Experience working on a two-sided consumer marketplace.

6\. Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent demonstrated ability.

## Frequently Asked Questions

>_What are your typical clients?_

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups at the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company already achieved a product-market fit and is looking to expand rapidly. That’s where we bring the best engineering practices, strong architecture, and the latest technologies to help companies scale.

>_What is the length of your engagements?_

Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years so you are able to evolve your career with the company you are currently working in.

>_What’s your company size?_

The Right Balance team is 60+ engineers going to 100 by the end of the year. The current client size engineering team is around 15 people. The timing is great to be a part of a rapidly growing team making meaningful contributions.

>_What happens if the engagement is completed?_

Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current engagement is ramping down, we’ll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.

>_What are your core values?_

Client First: we only win when our clients win. We treat client challenges as our own.

Ownership: we embrace responsibility, taking on challenges, getting them to completion, and enjoying getting things done.

Quality: we’re passionate about achieving quality outcomes by applying meticulous attention to detail.

_data.title: Senior Support Engineer

children.value: Overview

We're looking for a strong senior-level Support Engineer. Headquartered in Los Angeles, California, Right Balance applies the latest technology and the best engineering practices to help businesses grow. We’re in the top 50 companies to watch in LA.
Project Details

Our client just raised a $50M series B round of funding and is looking to double the engineering team in the next 6 months. It’s your chance to join a high-quality engineering team with the hands-on CTO from SpaceX, MySpace, and Honest Company.

Text messaging adoption is growing rapidly. Now, an average person spends 23 hours a week texting. The product is a text messaging automation software platform allowing E-Commerce store owners to do most of their customer communication over text messaging as opposed to old-school calls and emails.
The technology stack is React.js on the front end with Redux Saga, Storybooks, slick-looking UI with a custom design system, and an AI-powered conversation builder using the Canvas API.

The back-end is powered by Python / Django backend API on top of a PostgreSQL database with Kafka processing high throughput text messages at the scale of 10s of millions of messages per day. Soon we’ll be adding NoSQL and Kubernetes into the mix. Join us, it’ll be a lot of fun!

Work with the latest and greatest technologies.

Work remotely at the comfort of your home or a shared co-working space.
Work on challenging problems, innovate, have fun while doing it.
Travel around the world. We offer occasional business trips to work with our clients face to face from their offices.

5+ years of full-time hands-on coding experience.
3+ years of full-time hands-on experience with Python, Django (or similar like Flask / FastAPI / Pyramid / Tornado).
2+ years of SQL experience.
Intermediate knowledge of raw SQL including but not limited to indexing, using different types of joins and group by.
Able to have a conversation about technical details speaking and writing English in real-time.
Ability to write clean, modular, scalable, well-tested code, setting an example for others.
Ability to lead by example, understand client’s goals, and create and implement solutions to achieve them in a team setting proactively.
Strong knowledge of scalable backend API performance and tools.
Experience with unit testing.
A clear understanding of the runtime complexity of the code being written.
Ability to think outside of the box and work on the same project long-term with a high degree of care.
Nice to haves
A formal Computer Science degree.
Working experience in a proper Agile / Scrum team environment.
Deep understanding of automated testing, ability to set up automated
testing frameworks, testing architecture, data seeding, mocking, and implementing best testing practices.
Deep understanding of runtime complexity and memory complexity using
Big O notation.
Growth stage startup experience.
Technical leadership experience.
Frequently Asked Questions
What are your typical clients?

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups at the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company already achieved a product-market fit and looking to expand rapidly. That’s where we bring the best engineering practices, strong architecture, and the latest technologies to help companies scale.

Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years.

The Right Balance team is 10 - 15 engineers. The current client size team is 20 people looking to double it this year. It’s exciting to be a part of this growth making some meaningful contributions.
What happens if the engagement is completed?
Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current project is ramping down, we’ll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.
What are your core values?

We value autonomy, grind, empathy, mastery, and giving back to the community. We expect you to be autonomous, working directly with the client to build the best product. We value hard work, helping each other, constant learning as well as open-source contributions, and knowledge sharing.

_data.text:
# Overview

We're looking for a strong senior-level Support Engineer. Headquartered in Los Angeles, California, Right Balance applies the latest technology and the best engineering practices to help businesses grow. We’re in the top 50 companies to watch in LA.

# Project Details

Our client just raised a $50M series B round of funding and is looking to double the engineering team in the next 6 months. It’s your chance to join a high-quality engineering team with the hands-on CTO from SpaceX, MySpace, and Honest Company.

Text messaging adoption is growing rapidly. Now, an average person spends 23 hours a week texting. The product is a text messaging automation software platform allowing E-Commerce store owners to do most of their customer communication over text messaging as opposed to old-school calls and emails.

The technology stack is React.js on the front end with Redux Saga, Storybooks, slick-looking UI with a custom design system, and an AI-powered conversation builder using the Canvas API.

The back-end is powered by Python / Django backend API on top of a PostgreSQL database with Kafka processing high throughput text messages at the scale of 10s of millions of messages per day. Soon we’ll be adding NoSQL and Kubernetes into the mix. Join us, it’ll be a lot of fun!

# What’s in it for you

1. Work with the latest and greatest technologies.
2. Learn from the best people. We constantly challenge the status quo, learn from each other, and invent new ways of building a great product.
3. We take advantage of the latest automation tools like automatic deployments, CI/CD pipelines, and more.
4. Flexible hours. Just join daily standups, sprint planning, and retrospective meetings. Other than that you’re in control of your own schedule.
5. Work remotely at the comfort of your home or a shared co-working space.
6. Work on challenging problems, innovate, have fun while doing it.
7. Travel around the world. We offer occasional business trips to work with our clients face to face from their offices.

# Required Qualifications

 1. 5+ years of full-time hands-on coding experience.
 2. 3+ years of full-time hands-on experience with Python, Django (or similar like Flask / FastAPI / Pyramid / Tornado).
 3. 2+ years of SQL experience.
 4. Intermediate knowledge of raw SQL including but not limited to indexing, using different types of joins and group by.
 5. Able to have a conversation about technical details speaking and writing English in real-time.
 6. Ability to write clean, modular, scalable, well-tested code, setting an example for others.
 7. Ability to lead by example, understand client’s goals, and create and implement solutions to achieve them in a team setting proactively.
 8. Strong knowledge of scalable backend API performance and tools.
 9. Experience with unit testing.
10. A clear understanding of the runtime complexity of the code being written.
11. Ability to think outside of the box and work on the same project long-term with a high degree of care.

# Nice to haves

1. A formal Computer Science degree.
2. Working experience in a proper Agile / Scrum team environment.
3. Deep understanding of automated testing, ability to set up automated

   testing frameworks, testing architecture, data seeding, mocking, and implementing best testing practices.
4. Deep understanding of runtime complexity and memory complexity using

   Big O notation.
5. Growth stage startup experience.
6. Technical leadership experience.

## Frequently Asked Questions

> _What are your typical clients?_

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups at the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company already achieved a product-market fit and looking to expand rapidly. That’s where we bring the best engineering practices, strong architecture, and the latest technologies to help companies scale.

> _What is the length of your projects?_

Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years.

> _What’s your company size?_

The Right Balance team is 10 - 15 engineers. The current client size team is 20 people looking to double it this year. It’s exciting to be a part of this growth making some meaningful contributions.

> _What happens if the engagement is completed?_

Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current project is ramping down, we’ll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.

> _What are your core values?_

We value autonomy, grind, empathy, mastery, and giving back to the community. We expect you to be autonomous, working directly with the client to build the best product. We value hard work, helping each other, constant learning as well as open-source contributions, and knowledge sharing.

_data.title: Senior TechOps Engineer
_data.cta_header: Interested in being our TechOps engineer?

children.value: Overview

We're looking for a strong senior-level TechOps engineer. Headquartered in Los Angeles, California, Right Balance applies the latest technology and the best engineering practices to help businesses grow. We’re in the top 50 companies to watch in LA.
Project Details

Our client’s mission is to connect online and offline identities in a way that promotes understanding, fairness, and accountability; aiming to use this connected identity to better inform the most important decisions we make as humans. Backed by some of the world’s leading venture capitalists and institutional investors, they are an AI-based software solution that identifies problematic behavior among potential hires and current employees by analyzing publicly available online information. Enterprise Human Resources and Talent Acquisition Leaders from numerous large companies trust them to identify abusive behaviors, such as bigotry and harassment, that are often missed in the hiring and management process.

By using Data Science and Machine Learning, they are helping hundreds of brands across the globe to screen thousands of people every month, while rapidly growing their traffic 30% month over month by utilizing the SaaS model.

Our Python-based Serverless Microservices with FastAPI on the backend power our modern web frontend applications written in React / Redux. Lots of greenfield development for new Microservices as well as Microfrontends. We’re using the latest AWS services like Aurora, Lambda, EventBridge, believing in automated testing and solid DevOps principles. Plenty of scaling challenges as well as exposure to Machine Learning and Data Science. Join us, it’ll be fun!
What’s in it for you
Work with the latest and greatest technologies.
Learn from the best people. We constantly challenge the status quo, learn from each other, and invent new ways of building a great product.
We actually write automated tests. We take advantage of the latest automation tools like automatic deployments, CI/CD pipelines, and more.
Flexible hours. Just join daily standups, sprint planning, and retrospective meetings. Other than that you’re in control of your own schedule.
Work remotely at the comfort of your home or a shared co-working space.
Work on challenging problems, innovate, have fun while doing it.
Travel around the world. We offer occasional business trips to work with our clients face to face from their offices.
Required Qualifications
2+ years of hands on full time Infrastructure as code experience
5+ years of hands-on experience in at least one of the primary areas of TechOps focus: DevOps, DataOps, SecOps, or ProdOps
5+ years of hands-on experience in the other primary areas of TechOps focus: DevOps, DataOps, SecOps, or ProdOps
3+ years of experience building and managing software products on AWS cloud services preferably focused on AWS serverless technologies
1+ years working within teams that believe in and live the principles of lean-agile, DevOps-guided product development
Upper-intermediate to Advanced level of verbal English.

Regardless of area of expertise, have the desire and ability to participate in ProdOps within a high-volume SaaS company, including being on call to coordinate response to, and participate in the solution of, production issues.
Strong ability to communicate clearly and authoritatively with both technical and non-technical teams.
Ability to help determine when to build something ourselves, and when to buy technology to fit our use cases.
Comfortable working with diverse people and teams across the organization, from operations analysts to the CEO and being able to communicate across the organization on all aspects of TechOps.
Ability to iteratively design and build solutions aligned to the roadmap.
Serve as a subject matter expert in your primary area(s) of expertise.
Lead and participate in production support and incident response.
Believe in the client’s mission, work every day to live that mission, and help others do the same.
Natural desire and ability to mentor and teach those you work with.
Belief that in the world of TechOps, documentation is not waste.
Nice to haves
Professional experience with many of these technologies: Java, Python, Golang, Javascript, React, Spring, Django, Cassandra, Kafka, MongoDB, Postgres, or other RDBMS.
Knowledge of Runtime and memory complexity using Big O notation.
Deep understanding of automated testing, ability to set up automated testing frameworks, testing architecture, data seeding, mocking, and implementing best testing practices.
Open-source contributions, presentations, and publications.
Assist in selecting vendors to provide solutions when we choose not to build them ourselves.
Team leadership experience.
Team management experience.
Frequently Asked Questions
What are your typical clients?

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups at the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company already achieved a product-market fit and is looking to expand rapidly. That’s where we bring the best engineering practices, strong architecture, and the latest technologies to help companies scale.
What is the length of your projects?
Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years.
What’s your company size?

The Right Balance team is 30+ engineers looking to double by the end of the year. The current client size team is over 40 engineers with close to 200 total employees, looking to keep growing fast and aiming to hire up to 150 new employees over the next year. It’s your opportunity to be a part of this growth making meaningful contributions in a team of highly skilled professionals.
What happens if the engagement is completed?
Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current project is ramping down, we’ll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.
What are your core values?

We value autonomy, grind, empathy, mastery, and giving back to the community. We expect you to be autonomous, working directly with the client to build the best product. We value hard work, helping each other, constant learning as well as open-source contributions, and knowledge sharing.

3. We actually write automated tests. We take advantage of the latest automation tools like automatic deployments, CI/CD pipelines, and more.
4. Flexible hours. Just join daily standups, sprint planning, and retrospective meetings. Other than that you’re in control of your own schedule.
5. Work remotely at the comfort of your home or a shared co-working space.
6. Work on challenging problems, innovate, have fun while doing it.
7. Travel around the world. We offer occasional business trips to work with our clients face to face from their offices.

## Required Qualifications

 1. 2+ years of hands on full time Infrastructure as code experience
 2. 5+ years of hands-on experience in at least one of the primary areas of TechOps focus: DevOps, DataOps, SecOps, or ProdOps
 3. 5+ years of hands-on experience in the other primary areas of TechOps focus: DevOps, DataOps, SecOps, or ProdOps
 4. 3+ years of experience building and managing software products on AWS cloud services preferably focused on AWS serverless technologies
 5. 1+ years working within teams that believe in and live the principles of lean-agile, DevOps-guided product development
 6. Upper-intermediate to Advanced level of verbal English.
 7. Regardless of area of expertise, have the desire and ability to participate in ProdOps within a high-volume SaaS company, including being on call to coordinate response to, and participate in the solution of, production issues.
 8. Strong ability to communicate clearly and authoritatively with both technical and non-technical teams.
 9. Ability to help determine when to build something ourselves, and when to buy technology to fit our use cases.
10. Comfortable working with diverse people and teams across the organization, from operations analysts to the CEO and being able to communicate across the organization on all aspects of TechOps.
11. Ability to iteratively design and build solutions aligned to the roadmap.
12. Serve as a subject matter expert in your primary area(s) of expertise.
13. Lead and participate in production support and incident response.
14. Believe in the client’s mission, work every day to live that mission, and help others do the same.
15. Natural desire and ability to mentor and teach those you work with.
16. Belief that in the world of TechOps, documentation is not waste.

## Nice to haves

1. Professional experience with many of these technologies: Java, Python, Golang, Javascript, React, Spring, Django, Cassandra, Kafka, MongoDB, Postgres, or other RDBMS.
2. Knowledge of Runtime and memory complexity using Big O notation.
3. Deep understanding of automated testing, ability to set up automated testing frameworks, testing architecture, data seeding, mocking, and implementing best testing practices.
4. Open-source contributions, presentations, and publications.
5. Assist in selecting vendors to provide solutions when we choose not to build them ourselves.
6. Team leadership experience.
7. Team management experience.

## Frequently Asked Questions

> What are your typical clients?

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups at the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company already achieved a product-market fit and is looking to expand rapidly. That’s where we bring the best engineering practices, strong architecture, and the latest technologies to help companies scale.

> What is the length of your projects?

Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years.

> What’s your company size?

The Right Balance team is 30+ engineers looking to double by the end of the year. The current client size team is over 40 engineers with close to 200 total employees, looking to keep growing fast and aiming to hire up to 150 new employees over the next year. It’s your opportunity to be a part of this growth making meaningful contributions  in a team of highly skilled professionals.

> What happens if the engagement is completed?

Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current project is ramping down, we’ll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.

> What are your core values?

We value autonomy, grind, empathy, mastery, and giving back to the community. We expect you to be autonomous, working directly with the client to build the best product. We value hard work, helping each other, constant learning as well as open-source contributions, and knowledge sharing.

_data.text:
## Overview

We're looking for a strong Site Reliability Engineer. Headquartered in Los Angeles, California, Right Balance applies the latest technology and the best engineering practices to help businesses grow. We’re in the top 50 companies to watch in LA.

## Engagement Details

Our client is a rapidly growing SaaS startup that raised a $25.9M Series B round funding. They enable the world’s top real estate agents and brokers with award winning websites and cutting edge technology to manage their online presence. Moving fast to be a one stop shop for everything from websites to marketing services, they are already the official website partner to powerful brokerages like Compass, Corcoran, Sotheby’s, and Coldwell Banker.

As a Site Reliability Engineer, you will design, operate, and maintain our AWS cloud infrastructure and provide frameworks, pipelines, and tooling for Engineering teams to support production applications design, deployment, and management. You will work with Infrastructure and Product Delivery teams, leverage tooling and automation to ensure the readiness of our Kubernetes clusters, improve observability, make sure our system scales, uptime performance, and support operational excellence practice. If you are interested in building scalable infrastructure to host thousands of small business websites, join us!

## What’s in it for you

1\. Work with the latest and greatest technologies for a venture-backed startup. 2. Learn from the best people. We constantly challenge the status quo, learn from each other, and invent new ways of building a great product.

3\. We actually write automated tests. We take advantage of the latest automation tools like automatic deployments, CI/CD pipelines, and more.

4\. Flexible hours. Just join daily standups, sprint planning, and retrospective meetings. Other than that you’re in control of your own schedule.

5\. Work remotely at the comfort of your home or a shared co-working space.

6\. Work on challenging problems, innovate, have fun while doing it.

7\. Travel around the world. We offer occasional business trips to work with our clients face to face from their offices.

## Required Qualifications

1\. 5+ years of total full-time hands-on experience with SRE / DevOps or SWE. 2. 2+ years of SRE / DevOps experience.

3\. 2+ years of Kubernetes experience.

4\. 2+ years of Cloud experience. (AWS, Google Cloud or Azure).

5\. Able to have a conversation about technical details speaking and writing English in real time.

6\. Understanding of Kubernetes components such as RBAC, Ingress controller, ServiceAccount, and role annotations.

7\. Experience in automating releases, continuous integration/delivery systems, and relevant tools (e.g., Jenkins, CircleCI, Github Actions, GitlabCI, etc.).

8\. Professional Experience with monitoring, observability systems such as Datadog and Prometheus.

9\. On-call rotation availability for incident troubleshoot incidents.

## Nice to haves

1\. 2+ years of experience as a Software Engineer. Proficiency in Golang is a plus. 

2\. Experience with infrastructure as code (Terraform or CloudFormation) 

3\. Working knowledge of GitOps, FluxCD, or ArgoCD is a plus

4\. Hands-on experience setting-up log aggregators as Fluentbit, FluentD, or LogStash. Experience setting up platforms like ELK stack or hybrids.

## Frequently Asked Questions

> _What are your typical clients?_

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups at the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company already achieved a product-market fit and is looking to expand rapidly. That’s where we bring the best engineering practices, strong architecture, and the latest technologies to help companies scale.

> _What is the length of your projects?_

Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years.

> _What’s your company size?_

The Right Balance team is 10 - 15 engineers. The current client team size is 30 engineers expanding to 50 engineers by the end of this year . It’s exciting to be a part of this growth making some meaningful contributions.

> _What happens if the engagement is completed?_

Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current project is ramping down, we’ll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.

> _What are your core values?_

We value autonomy, grind, empathy, mastery, and giving back to the community. We expect you to be autonomous, working directly with the client to build the best product. We value hard work, helping each other, constant learning, open-source contributions, and knowledge sharing.

. And will be expected to own the test automation for the main product of the company.

Travel around the world. We offer occasional business trips to work with our

3+years of professional full-time experience working as a QA.
3+ years of professional full-time experience with QA automation

1+ years of Cypress experience.
Intermediate to upper-intermediate speaking and writing English, able to
have a technical real-time conversation.

Experience scaling web applications.
Experience working with CDNs.
Ability to write clean and easy-to-understand automated tests.
Nice to Haves
A formal Computer Science or equivalent degree.
Docker experience (including the ability to support developers with the local
Docker tooling).
Typescript experience.

What are your typical clients?

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups in the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company already achieved a product-market fit and is looking to expand rapidly. Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years.

Client First: we only win when our clients win. We treat client challenges as our own.
Ownership: we embrace responsibility, taking on challenges, getting them to completion, and enjoying getting things done.
Quality: we’re passionate about achieving quality outcomes by applying meticulous attention to detail.

**_Overview_**

We're looking for a strong Software Development Engineer in Test to join our team. Headquartered in Los Angeles, California, Right Balance applies the latest technology and best engineering practices to help businesses grow. We’re in the top 50 companies to watch in LA.

  
**_Engagement Details_**

Our client is reinventing the formalwear rental industry so people can show up at their best on the days that matter most. The company designs and manufactures modern rental suits and tuxedos that actually fit—made of 100% wool, ordered online, and delivered for free. Using a combination of machine learning and industry-leading customer service, they guarantee a perfect fit every time.

Just as we are on the cutting edge of men's fashion, we also strive to stay on the cutting edge of technology and we are looking to hire talented engineers. Our biggest goals on the technology team are to deliver the best possible customer experience, build solutions that adhere to high software engineering principles, and strive to maintain a positive culture where diversity and personal growth are highly valued.

Our new engineer will be at the beginning of the establishment of the new test suite system using **Cypress**. And will be expected to own the test automation for the main product of the company.

Join us, it will be fun!

**_What’s in it for you?_**

1. Work with the latest and greatest technologies.
2. Learn from the best people. We constantly challenge the status quo, learn from each other, and invent new ways of building a great product.
3. We actually write automated tests. We take advantage of the latest automation tools like automatic deployments, CI/CD pipelines, and more.
4. Work remotely in the comfort of your home or a shared co-working space.
5. Work on challenging problems, innovate, and have fun while doing it.
6. Travel around the world. We offer occasional business trips to work with our  
    clients face-to-face from their offices.

**_Required Qualifications_**

1. 3+years of professional full-time experience working as a QA.
2. 3+ years of professional full-time experience with QA automation  
    development.
3. 1+ years of Cypress experience.
4. Intermediate to upper-intermediate speaking and writing English, able to  
    have a technical real-time conversation.
5. Knowledge of modern web technologies.
6. Experience scaling web applications.
7. Experience working with CDNs.
8. Ability to write clean and easy-to-understand automated tests.

**_Nice to Haves_**

1. A formal Computer Science or equivalent degree.
2. Docker experience (including the ability to support developers with the local  
    Docker tooling).
3. Typescript experience.

**_Frequently Asked Questions_**

**What are your typical clients?**

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups in the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company already achieved a product-market fit and is looking to expand rapidly. That’s where we bring the best engineering practices, strong architecture, and the latest technologies to help companies scale.

**What is the length of your engagements?**

Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years.

**What’s your company size?**

The Right Balance team has 60+ engineers going to 100+ by the end of the year. It’s exciting to be a part of a solid engineering team making meaningful contributions.

**What happens if the engagement is completed?**

Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current engagement is ramping down, we’ll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.

**What are your core values?**

* Client First: we only win when our clients win. We treat client challenges as our own.
* Ownership: we embrace responsibility, taking on challenges, getting them to completion, and enjoying getting things done.
* Quality: we’re passionate about achieving quality outcomes by applying meticulous attention to detail.

We're looking for a strong Data Engineer. Headquartered in Los Angeles, California, Right Balance applies the latest technology and the best engineering practices to help businesses grow. We’re in the top 50 companies to watch in LA.

## Engagement Details

Our client is a rapidly growing SaaS startup that raised a $25.9M Series B round funding. They enable the world’s top real estate agents and brokers with award-winning websites and cutting-edge technology to manage their online presence. Moving fast to be a one-stop-shop for everything from websites to marketing services, they are already the official website partner to powerful brokerages like Compass, Corcoran, Sotheby’s, and Coldwell Banker.

As a Software Engineer (Data), you will be working on our data pipeline orchestrated by various open source technologies. Data sources will vary from hundreds of data providers as well as from our very own platform analytics. You'll be joining a team primarily focused on providing accurate and consistent data to our platform and customers that care about shipping sustainable and tested solutions that will affect real-world real estate transactions. If you are interested in building scalable infrastructure to host thousands of small business websites or architecting an interactive editing experience for email marketing, join us!

## What’s in it for you

1\. Work with the latest and greatest technologies for a venture-backed startup. 2. Learn from the best people. We constantly challenge the status quo, learn from each other, and invent new ways of building a great product.

3\. We actually write automated tests. We take advantage of the latest automation tools like automatic deployments, CI/CD pipelines, and more.

4\. Flexible hours. Just join daily standups, sprint planning, and retrospective meetings. Other than that you’re in control of your own schedule.

5\. Work remotely at the comfort of your home or a shared co-working space.

6\. Work on challenging problems, innovate, and have fun.

7\. Travel around the world. We offer occasional business trips to work with our client's face to face from their offices.

## Required Qualifications

1\. 3+ years of full-time hands-on data engineer experience.

2\. 3+ years of experience with Java, Python or Go.

3\. 3+ years of SQL experience.

4\. Upper-intermediate to fluent speaking and writing English.

5\. Experience with Data pipelines (ETL, ELT, DB).

6\. Experience with data-driven architecture and systems design RESTful APIs.

7\. Experience with SQL, in-memory and/or distributed SQL (e.g. PostgreSQL, AuroraDB)

8\. Experience integrating with 3rd party APIs, external frameworks, and libraries.

9\. Embraces the concepts of Agile Scrum software development and its related collaboration and issue tracking tools (e.g. Freshworks, JIRA, Rally).

10\. Proven success working in Agile environments (Scrum, Kanban, etc.).

## Nice to haves

1\. Experience with Software as a Service (SaaS), and multi-tenancy application development.

2\. Serverless, microservices architecture experience.

3\. NoSQL experience with Redis / Dynamo.

## Frequently Asked Questions

> _What are your typical clients?_

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups at the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company already achieved a product-market fit and is looking to expand rapidly. That’s where we bring the best engineering practices, strong architecture, and the latest technologies to help companies scale.

> _What is the length of your projects?_

Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years.

> _What’s your company size?_

The Right Balance team is 10 - 15 engineers. The current client team size is 30 engineers expanding to 50 engineers by the end of this year. It’s exciting to be a part of this growth making some meaningful contributions.

> _What happens if the engagement is completed?_

Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current project is ramping down, we’ll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.

> _What are your core values?_

We value autonomy, grind, empathy, mastery, and giving back to the community. We expect you to be autonomous, working directly with the client to build the best product. We value hard work, helping each other, constant learning, open-source contributions, and knowledge sharing.
